text: Nations rich and poor must invest now to protect against destructive NN NN impacts already in DT pipeline or pay an even heavier price later , a JJ commission led by former UN head Ban Ki-moon warned Tuesday . Spending $ 1.8 trillion across five key areas over DT next decade MD not only help buffer DT worst impacts of JJ NN but MD generate more than $ 7 trillion in net benefits , DT report from DT NNP Commission on Adaptation argued . " JJ actions to slow NN NN are promising but insufficient , " DT report concluded . " PRP must invest in a massive effort to adapt to conditions WDT are now inevitable . " Investing now in early warning systems , NN - resistant infrastructure , mangrove protection , better agriculture and improving fresh NN resources MD pay for itself several times over , PRP VBD . Mangroves -- tropical tidal NN forests -- protect , for example , against storm surges and act as nurseries for commercial fisheries , but at least a third of them globally have been uprooted for tourism or aquaculture . Without action by 2030 , Ban told journalists , " NN NN MD push more than 100 million NNS in developing NNS below DT poverty line " . " NNS everywhere are experiencing DT devastating impacts of NN NN , " VBD Microsoft founder Bill Gates , co-chair of DT report along with NNP Bank CEO Kristalina Georgieva . In DT 25 - NN history of UN NN negotiations , adaptation has trailed far down DT agenda compared with " mitigation " , or DT reduction of carbon NNS . PRP was long seen as an issue only affecting poor and developing nations . But recent massive inland flooding and a string of record - breaking hurricanes in DT NNP NNPS , along with ferocious heatwaves in Europe and Japan , have shown IN wealth is not an adequate shield . " This is not just in DT developing NN but DT developed NN too , " VBD Dominic Molloy , a co-author of DT report from Britain 's Department for International Development . But a JJ focus on adapting should not detract from DT need to slash carbon pollution , he added . " PRP absolutely need to do both , reduce NNS and adapt , " Molloy told AFP . " DT purpose of this commission was to raise DT visibility of adaptation , not shift away from mitigation . " Failure to curb DT greenhouse gas NNS slow - roasting DT NN has already unleashed a crescendo of deadly heat waves , NN shortages and superstorms made more destructive by rising seas . DT Bahamas was devastated this month by CD of DT strongest Atlantic storms on record . NNP 's average surface temperature has gone up 1C since DT late 19th century , and is on track -- at current rates of CO2 NNS -- to warm another two or three degrees by century 's end . DT 2015 Paris Agreement calls for capping JJ NN at " well below " 2C , and 1.5C if possible . DT report 's $ 1.8 trillion adaptation price tag for DT period 2020 - 2030 is not an estimate of JJ needs , covering only warning systems and DT four other areas identified . DT $ 7.1 trillion dividend is based on DT NNP Bank calculation IN DT value of damage caused by NN NN is increasing , averaged across DT globe , at about 1.5 percent per NN . text: DT Arctic is predicted to warm faster than anywhere else in DT NN this century , perhaps by as much as 7°C . These rising temperatures threaten CD of DT largest long - term stores of carbon on land : permafrost . Permafrost is permanently frozen soil . DT generally cold temperatures in DT Arctic keep soils RB frozen NN - on - NN . Plants grow in DT uppermost soil layers during DT short summers and then decay into soil , which freezes when DT winter snow arrives . Over thousands of NNS , carbon has built up in these frozen soils , and PRP ’re now estimated to contain twice DT carbon currently in DT atmosphere . Some of this carbon is more than 50,000 NNS old , which means DT plants WDT decomposed to produce DT soil grew over 50,000 NNS ago . These soil deposits are known as “ Yedoma ” , which are mainly found in DT East Siberian Arctic , but RB in parts of Alaska and Canada . As DT region warms , DT permafrost is thawing , and this frozen carbon is being released to DT atmosphere as carbon dioxide and methane . Methane release is particularly worrying , as PRP ’s a highly potent greenhouse gas . But a recent NN suggested IN DT release of methane from ancient carbon sources – sometimes referred to as DT Arctic methane “ bomb ” – did n’t contribute much to DT NN WDT occurred during DT last deglaciation – DT period after DT last NN age . This occurred 18,000 to 8,000 NNS ago , a period WDT NN NNS VBP intently , as PRP ’s DT last NN JJ temperatures rose by 4°C , which is roughly what is predicted for DT NN by 2100 . This NN suggested to JJ IN ancient methane NNS are not something PRP should be worried about this century . But in JJ research , PRP found IN this optimism MD be misplaced . Read more : DT Arctic is turning brown because of weird weather – and PRP MD accelerate NN NN PRP went to DT East Siberian Arctic to compare DT age of different forms of carbon found in DT ponds , rivers and lakes . These waters thaw during DT summer and leak greenhouse gases from DT surrounding permafrost . PRP measured DT age of DT carbon dioxide , methane and organic matter found in these waters using radiocarbon dating and found IN most of DT carbon released to DT atmosphere was overwhelmingly “ young ” . Where EX was intense permafrost thaw , PRP found IN DT oldest methane was 4,800 NNS old , and DT oldest carbon dioxide was 6,000 NNS old . But over this vast Arctic landscape , DT carbon released was mainly from young plant organic matter . This means IN DT carbon produced by plants growing during each summer growing season is rapidly released over DT next few summers . This rapid turnover releases much more carbon than DT thaw of older permafrost , even where severe thaw is occurring . So what does this mean for future NN NN ? PRP means IN carbon NNS from a NN Arctic MD not be driven by DT thawing of an ancient frozen carbon bomb , as PRP ’s often described . Instead , most NNS MD be relatively JJ carbon WDT is produced by plants WDT grew fairly recently . What this shows is IN DT age of DT carbon released from DT NN Arctic is less important than DT amount and form PRP takes . Methane is 34 times more potent than carbon dioxide as a greenhouse gas over a 100 - NN timeframe . DT East Siberian Arctic is a generally flat and wet landscape , and these are conditions which produce lots of methane , as EX ’s less oxygen in soils which might otherwise create carbon dioxide during thaws instead . As a result , potent methane MD well dominate DT greenhouse gas NNS from DT region . Since most of DT NNS from DT Arctic this century will likely be from “ young ” carbon , PRP MD not need to worry about ancient permafrost adding substantially to modern NN NN . But DT Arctic will still be a huge source of carbon NNS , as carbon WDT was soil or plant matter only a few hundred NNS ago leaches to DT atmosphere . DT will increase as warmer temperatures lengthen growing seasons in DT Arctic summer . DT fading spectre of an ancient methane NN bomb is cold comfort . DT JJ research should urge DT NN to act boldly on NN NN , to limit how much natural processes in DT Arctic can contribute to DT problem .

If PRP see PRP from a bigger perspective , basically nothing has been done . PRP will require much more than this . This is just DT very beginning , ” she VBD . text: Mainstream Scientist Exposes DT Dangerous Reality of Chemtrails and Geoengineering Over DT past few NNS , DT issue of geoengineering has been popularized . Mainstream NN , academia , and NN almost unanimously support DT idea of geoengineering as a perceived solution to NN NN while suppressing DT evidence IN PRP has actually been in use for some NN without our consent . On DT other hand , EX is a growing number of NNS who are slowly beginning to understand DT reality surrounding chemtrail geoengineering , and opposition is slowly growing . In a bold move against DT establishment , Kate Marvel , a mainstream scientist who specializes in “ NN NN , ” spoke out at a Ted Talk against DT onset of NN engineering with chemtrails , RB known as Solar Radiation Management or “ SRM . ” Firstly , computer theorist and founding partner of tech company Applied Invention , Danny Hillis , came on stage and proposed a number of geoengineering concepts which MD theoretically , “ turn down DT temperature of DT NN . ” These included sending giant parasols into space , putting fizzy NN into DT ocean , and sending chalk into DT atmosphere at a rate of 10 teragrams per NN to reflect sunlight and in theory slow DT effects of NN NN . Now enters Kate Marvel with DT opening line , “ Danny , PRP seem so nice , and I hope PRP can be friends , and PRP terrify me . ” Marvel RB noted IN atmospheric spraying MD not do anything to effect other environmental problems such as ocean acidification . GeoEngineering refers to technologies which are used with DT intention of interfering with DT NN ’s atmosphere in order to alter temperatures and NN . Most of these technologies are still in theoretical stages , however a growing body of evidence suggests IN some weather modification technologies such as aerosol spraying or “ cloud seeding ” have been in production for JJ decades . Almost no studies have been done which assess DT effect WDT cloud seeding has on environmental safety or human NN , which shows IN DT NN has been using untested technologies on DT population without our consent . In 2016 , CIA Director John O. Brennan spoke at a Council on Foreign Relations conference about DT benefits of geoengineering . However , any mention of potential negative impacts as a result of cloud seeding was conveniently left out . Evidence VBG as far back as DT early 1920 ’s shows a push to develop DT technology needed to control DT weather and has been implemented in some form since at least DT 1970’s . This information has been uncovered in various forms , CD of those being patents which range from April 27th of 1920 to NNP of 2003 showing interest in DT development of various forms of weather modification technologies . text: Anthropogenic NN NN is already a reality in Africa , as PRP is elsewhere in DT NN . According to DT Intergovernmental Panel on NNP NNP , Africa is among DT most vulnerable continents to NN NN . [ 1] [ 2 ] DT vulnerability of Africa to NN NN is driven by a range of factors WDT includes weak adaptive capacity , high dependence on ecosystem goods for livelihoods , and less developed agricultural production systems . [ 3 ] DT risks of NN NN on agricultural production , food security , NN resources and ecosystem services will likely have increasingly severe consequences on lives and sustainable development prospects in Africa . [ 4 ] Managing this risk requires integration of mitigation and adaptation strategies in DT management of ecosystem goods and services , and DT agriculture production systems in Africa . [ 5 ] Over DT coming decades , NN from NN NN is expected across almost all DT NN 's surface , and JJ mean rainfall will increase . [ 6 ] Regional effects on rainfall in DT tropics are expected to be much more spatially variable and DT sign of NN at any CD location is often less certain , although changes are expected . Consistent with this , observed surface temperatures have generally increased over Africa since DT late 19th century to DT early 21st century by about 1 °C , but locally as much as 3 °C for minimum temperature in DT Sahel at DT end of DT dry season . [ 7 ] Observed precipitation trends indicate spatial and temporal discrepancies as expected . [ 8 ] [ 2 ] DT observed changes in temperature and precipitation vary regionally . [ 9 ] [ 8 ] In terms of adaptation efforts , regional - level actors are making some progress . This includes DT development and adoption of several regional NN NN adaptation strategies [ 10 ] e.g. SADC Policy Paper NNP NNP , [ 11 ] and DT adaptation strategy for DT NN sector . [ 12 ] In addition , EX has been other efforts to enhance NN NN adaptation , such as DT tripatite Programme on NN NN Adaptation and Mitigation in Eastern and Southern Africa ( COMESA-EAC-SADC ) . [ 13 ] As a supranational organisation of 55 member NNS , DT African Union has put forward 47 goals and corresponding actions in a 2014 draft report [ 14 ] to combat and mitigate NN NN on DT continent . DT Secretary General of DT NNP Nations has RB declared a need for close cooperation with DT African Union in order to tackle NN NN , in accordance with DT UN 's sustainable development goals . NN NN will increasingly impact Africa due to JJ factors . These impacts are already being felt and will increase in magnitude if action is not taken to reduce JJ carbon NNS . DT impacts include higher temperatures , drought , changing rainfall patterns and increased NN variability . These conditions have a bearing on NN production and consumption . DT recent drought in JJ African NNS , which has been linked to NN NN , adversely affected both NN security and JJ growth across DT continent . Agriculture is inherently sensitive to NN conditions and is CD of DT most vulnerable sectors to DT risks and impacts of JJ NN NN . [ 17 ] Agriculture in most African NNS is mainly small - scale and rain - fed , making PRP particularly vulnerable to NN variability and NN . Observed and projected disruptions in precipitation patterns due to NN NN are likely to shorten growing seasons and affect crop yield in JJ parts of Africa . Furthermore , DT agriculture sector in Africa is dominated by smallholder farmers with limited access to technology and DT resources to adapt . [ 18 ] NN variability and NN have been and continue to be , DT principal source of fluctuations in JJ food production in NNS of DT developing NN where production is highly rain - dependent . [ CD ] DT agriculture sector is sensitive to NN variability , [ 20 ] especially DT inter-annual variability of precipitation , temperature patterns , and extreme weather events ( droughts and floods ) . These climatic events are predicted to increase in DT future and are expected to have significant consequences to DT agriculture sector . [ 21 ] This MD have a negative influence on food prices , food security , and land - use decisions . [ 22 ] Yields from rainfed agriculture in some African NNS MD be reduced by up to 50 % by 2020 . [ 21 ] In order to prevent DT future destructive impact of NN variability on food production , PRP is crucial to adjust or suggest possible policies to cope with increased NN variability . African NNS need to build a national legal framework to manage food resources in accordance with DT anticipated NN variability . However , before devising a policy to cope with DT impacts of NN variability , especially to DT agriculture sector , PRP is critical to have a clear understanding of how NN variability affects different food crops . In DT NN 2020 , sever invasion of Locusts harmed DT agriculture in eastern Africa . DT invasion is at least partly due to NN NN - DT warmer temperature and heavier rainfall caused an abnormal increase in DT number of locusts [ 23 ] NN quality and availability have deteriorated in most areas of Africa particularly due to NN NN . Previous research and NN projections provide enough evidence IN NN resources are vulnerable and have DT possibility of being strongly impacted by NN NN with vast ramifications on human societies . [ 24 ] DT IPCC predicts millions of NNS in Africa will persistently face increased NN stress due to NN variability and NN ( IPCC 2013 ) . Changes in precipitation patterns directly affect surface runoff and NN availability . [ 25 ] Any changes to DT hydrological cycle MD have significant effects on river basins of Africa . To improve understanding of past and future changes in NN availability due to NN NN , DT IPCC ( IPCC 2013 ) recommends using DT dynamic downscaling technique . DT IPCC 2013 proposed using DT coordinated regional downscaling experiment ( CORDEX ) regional NN models which runs at a maximum of 50 km resolutions , DT resolution used depends upon DT size of DT watershed and area coverage by DT meteorological records . However , before using DT NN simulations from DT dynamic downscaling , PRP is appropriate to evaluate their performance at different spatial scales since their performance differs from CD location to another and from CD RCM to another . African NNS have DT least efficient JJ NN systems in DT NN . [ 26 ] Infectious NN burdens such as malaria , schistosomiasis , dengue fever , meningitis , which are sensitive to NN impacts , are highest in DT sub-Saharan African region . For instance , over 90 percent of annual JJ malaria NNS are in Africa . [ 26 ] Changes in NN will affect DT spread of infectious agents as well as alter NNS ’s disposition to these infections . With increasing population and corresponding NN demand , NN security must be addressed because NN is crucial for sustainable development . NN NN has affected NN sectors in Africa as JJ NNS depend on hydropower generation . Decreasing rainfall levels and droughts have resulted in lower NN levels in dams with adverse impacts on hydropower generation . This has resulted in low electrical NN production , high cost of electricity and power outages or load - shedding in some African NNS WDT depend on hydroelectric power generation . Disruptions in hydropower generation have negatively affected various sectors in NNS such as Ghana , Uganda , Kenya , Tanzania . Central Africa , for DT most part , is landlocked and is geographically threatened by NN NN . Due to its high NN variability and rainfed agriculture , Central Africa is expected to experience longer and more frequent heatwaves as well as an increase in wet extremes . [ 27 ] DT JJ mean temperature in this region is to increase by 1.5 °C to 2 °C . [ 28 ] Angola - " DT objective of DT National Adaptation Programs of Action are to identify and communicate DT urgent and immediate needs of DT country regarding NN NN adaptation , to increase Angola ‘s resilience to NN variabilities and to NN NN to ensure achievement of Poverty reduction programs , sustainable development objectives and DT Millennium Development Goals pursued by DT NNP . " [ 29 ] DT carbon dioxide - absorbing capacity of forests in DT Congo Basin have decreased . This decrease has occurred due to increasing heat and drought causing decreased tree growth . This suggests IN even unlogged forests are being affected by NN NN . A Nature NN indicates IN by 2030 , DT African jungle will absorb 14 percent less carbon dioxide than PRP did from around 2005 - 2010 , and will absorb none at all by 2035 . [ 30 ] Situated almost entirely in DT tropics , rainfall in Eastern Africa is dominated by DT seasonal migration of DT tropical - rain band . [ 31 ] Eastern Africa is characterized by high spatio - temporal rainfall variability as PRP spans over 30 degrees of latitude ( across DT equator ) . PRP has influences from both DT Indian and Atlantic Oceans , and has major orographic features ( highlands ) as well as inland NN bodies such as Lake Victoria . Therefore DT rainfall seasonality varies from a single wet season per NN in July –August in parts of DT northwest ( including Ethiopia and South Sudan , which are meteorologically more connected to West Africa , with DT West African monsoon bringing DT rains ) to a single wet season per NN in December - February in DT south ( over Tanzania ) , with JJ areas close to DT equator having two rainy seasons per NN , [ 32 ] approximately in March–May ( DT “ Long Rains ” ) and October to December ( DT “ Short Rains ” ) . Fine - scale variability in rainfall seasonality is often linked to orography and lakes . Inter - annual variability can be large and known controls include variations in NN surface temperatures ( SSTs ) of different ocean basins , large - scale atmospheric modes of variability such as DT Madden - Julian Osciliation ( MJO ) [ 33 ] [ 34 ] and tropical cyclones . [ 34 ] [ 35 ] Eastern Africa has witnessed frequent and severe droughts in recent decades , as well as devastating floods . Trends in rainfall since DT 1980s show a general decrease in March - NNP ( MAM ) seasonal rains with a slight increase during June - September ( JJAS ) and October - December ( OND ) rains , [ 36 ] although EX appears to have been a recent recovery in DT MAM rains . [ 37 ] In DT future , both rainfall and temperature are projected to VB over Eastern Africa . [ 38 ] [ 39 ] [ 40 ] Recent studies on NN projections suggest IN average temperature might increase by about 2 - 3 °C by DT middle of DT century and 2 - 5 °C at DT end of DT century . [ 41 ] This will depend on emission scenarios as well as on how DT real NN responds compared with DT range of possible outcomes shown by models . NN model projections tend to show an increase in rainfall , particularly during OND season , which is RB projected to occur later . This delay in DT short rain season , has been linked to DT deepening of DT Saharan Heat Low under NN NN . [ 42 ] PRP should be noted , however IN some models predict decreasing rainfall , [ 40 ] [ 41 ] and for some regions and seasons DT very largest rainfall increases predicted have been shown to involve implausible mechanisms due to systematic model errors . [ 43 ] In addition , changes of aerosols provide a forcing of rainfall NN WDT is not captured in JJ assessments of NN projections . [ 44 ] [ 45 ] DT contrast of DT drying trend of MAM ( long rains ) rainfall in equatorial Eastern Africa , with most models predicting a wetting in DT future has been labelled DT “ East African NN NN paradox , " [ 45 ] although EX has been some recent recovery in DT rainfall . [ 37 ] Studies have shown IN DT drying trend is unlikely to be purely natural , but MD be driven by factors such as aerosols rather than greenhouse gases , [ 45 ] further research is needed . DT drying has been shown to be have been caused by a shorter rainy season , and linked to deepening of DT Arabian Heat Low . [ 37 ] Consistent with DT uncertainty in rainfall projections , changes in rainy seasons onset are uncertain in equatorial Eastern Africa , although JJ models predict a later and wetter short rains . [ 42 ] DT Indian Ocean Dipole ( IOD ) is known to provide a strong control on inter-annual variability in DT short rains , [ 46 ] and studies show IN extreme IODs MD increase under NN NN . [ 47 ] Globally , NN NN is expected to lead to intensification of rainfall , as extreme rainfall increases at a faster rate with NN than total rainfall does . [ 6 ] Recent work shows IN across Africa JJ models are expected to under -estimate DT rate of NN of this rainfall intensification , [ 48 ] and changes in rainfall extremes MD be much more widespread than those predicted by JJ models . [ 49 ] Southern parts of Eastern Africa receive most of their rainfall in a single rainy season during DT southern hemisphere ’s winter : over Tanzania seasonal rainfall is projected to increase under future NN NN , although EX is uncertainty . [ 42 ] Further south , over Mozambique , a shorter season due to a later onset is projected under future NN NN , again with some uncertainty . [ 50 ] Comoros - " NAPA is DT operational extension of DT Poverty Reduction Strategy Paper ( PRSP ) , as PRP includes among its adaptation priorities , agriculture , fishing , NN , housing , NN , but RB tourism , in an indirect way , through DT reconstitution of basin slopes and DT fight against soils erosion , and therefore DT protection of reefs by limiting DT silting up by terrigenous contributions . [ 51 ] " Kenya gazetted DT NNP NNP Act , 2016 which establishes an authority to oversee development , management , implementation and regulation of mechanisms to enhance NN NN resilience and low carbon development for sustainable development , by DT National and County Governments , DT private sector , civil society , and other actors . Kenya has RB developed DT National NNP NNP Action Plan ( NCCAP 2018 - 2022 ) which aims to further DT country 's development goals by providing mechanisms and measures to achieve low carbon NN - resilient development in a manner WDT prioritizes adaptation . Madagascar - DT priority sectors for adaptation are : agriculture and livestock , forestry , JJ NN , NN resources and coastal zones . [ 52 ] Malawi - DT NAPA identifies DT following as high priority activities for adaptation : " Improving community resilience to NN NN through DT development of sustainable rural livelihoods , Restoring forests in DT Upper and Lower Shire Valleys catchments to reduce siltation and associated NN flow problems , Improving agricultural production under erratic rains and changing climatic conditions , Improving Malawi ’s preparedness to cope with droughts and floods , and Improving NN monitoring to enhance Malawi ’s early warning capability and decision making and sustainable utilization of Lake Malawi and lakeshore areas resources [ 53 ] " . Mauritius - adaptation should address DT following priority areas : coastal resources , agriculture , NN resources , fisheries , NN and well - being , land use NN and forestry and biodiversity . [ 54 ] Mozambique - " DT proposed adaptation initiatives target various areas of JJ and social development , and outline projects related to DT reduction of impacts to natural disasters , DT creation of adaptation measures to NN NN , fight against soil erosion in areas of high desertification and coastal zones , reforestation and DT management of NN resources . [ 55 ] " Rwanda has developed DT National Adaptation Programme of Action ( NAPA 2006 ) which contains information to guide national policy - makers and planners on priority vulnerabilities and adaptations in important JJ sectors . [ 56 ] DT country has RB developed sector based policies on adaptation to NN NN such as DT Vision 2020 , DT National Environmental Policy and DT Agricultural Policy among others . [ 57 ] Tanzania Tanzania has outlined priority adaptation measures in their NAPA , and various national sector strategies and research outputs . [ 58 ] DT NAPA has been successful at encouraging NN NN mainstreaming into sector policies in Tanzania ; however , DT cross-sectoral collaboration crucial to implementing adaptation strategies remains limited due to institutional challenges such as power imbalances , budget constraints and an ingrained sectoral approach . [ 59 ] Most of DT projects in Tanzania concern agriculture and NN resource management ( irrigation , NN saving , rainwater collection ) ; however , NN and tourism RB play an important role . [ 60 ] Zambia - " DT NAPA identifies 39 urgent adaptation needs and 10 priority areas within DT sectors of agriculture and food security ( livestock , fisheries and crops ) , NN and NN , human NN , natural resources and wildlife [ 61 ] " Zimbabwe - " DT other strategic interventions by DT NAP process will be : Strengthening DT role of private sector in adaptation planning , Enhancing of DT capacity of NN to develop bankable projects through trainings , Improving management of background NN information to inform NN NN planning , Crafting a proactive resource - mobilization strategy for identifying and applying for international NN finance as requests for funds are primarily reactive at present , focusing on emergency relief rather than NN NN risk reduction , preparedness and adaptation , Developing a coordinated monitoring and evaluation policy for programs and projects , as JJ institutions within DT NN do not currently have a systematic approach to monitoring and evaluation . [ 62 ] " Lesotho - " DT key objectives of DT NAPA process entail : identification of communities and livelihoods most vulnerable to NN NN , generating a list of activities WDT MD form a core of DT national adaptation program of action , and to communicate DT country ’s immediate and urgent needs and priorities for building capacity for adaptation to NN NN [ 63 ] " Namibia - DT critical themes for adaptation are " Food security and sustainable biological resource base , Sustainable NN resources base , Human NN and well being and Infrastructure development [ 64 ] " South Africa is in DT progress of finalizing its national NN NN adaptation strategy . " DT National Adaptation strategy acts as a common reference point for NN NN adaptation efforts in South Africa , and PRP provides a platform upon which national NN NN adaptation objectives for DT country can be articulated so as to provide overarching guidance to all sectors of DT economy [ 65 ] " DT West African region can be divided into four climatic sub-regions namely DT Guinea Coast , Soudano - Sahel , Sahel ( extending eastward to DT Ethiopian border ) and DT Sahara , [ 66 ] each with different climatic conditions . DT seasonal cycle of rainfall is mainly driven by DT south - north movement of DT Inter - Tropical Convergence Zone ( ITCZ ) which is characterised by DT confluence between moist southwesterly monsoon winds and DT dry northeasterly Harmattan . [ 67 ] Based on DT inter -annual rainfall variability , three main climatic periods have been observed over DT Sahel : DT wet period from 1950 to DT early 1960s followed by a dry period from 1972 to 1990 and then DT period from 1991 onwards which has seen a partial rainfall recovery . [ 68 ] [ 69 ] [ 70 ] During DT dry period , DT Sahel experienced a number of particularly severe drought events , with devastating effects . [ 71 ] [ 72 ] DT recent decades , have RB witnessed a moderate increment in annual rainfall since DT beginning of 1990s . However , total annual rainfall remains significantly below DT observed during DT 1950s . [ 73 ] [ 71 ] Some have identified DT recent 2 decades as a recovery period . [ 74 ] Others refer to this as a period of ‘ hydrological intensification ’ with much of DT annual rainfall increase coming from more severe rain events and sometimes flooding rather than more frequent rainfall , or similarly other works [ 75 ] [ 76 ] underline DT continuity of DT drought even though DT rainfall has increased . Since 1985 , 54 percent of DT population has been affected by five or more floods in DT 17 Sahel region NNS . [ 77 ] In 2012 , severe drought conditions in DT Sahel were reported . Governments in DT region responded quickly , launching strategies to address DT issue . [ 78 ] DT region is projected to experience changes in rainfall regime , with NN models suggesting IN decreases in wet season rainfall are more likely in DT western Sahel , and increases more likely in DT central to east Sahel , although opposite trends can not yet be ruled out . [ 79 ] [ 80 ] [ 81 ] These trends will affect DT frequency and severity of floods , droughts , desertification , sand and dust storms , desert locust plagues and NN shortages . [ 82 ] [ 83 ] However , irrespective of DT changes in seasonal mean rain , DT most intense storms are expected to become more intense , amplifying flood frequency . [ 84 ] [ 85 ] Enhanced carbon NNS and JJ NN MD RB lead to an increase in dry spells especially across DT Guinea Coast associated with a reduction of DT wet spells under both 1.5 ℃ and 2 ℃ JJ NN level . [ 86 ] Fifteen percent of Sahel region population has RB experienced a temperature increase of more than 1 °C from 1970 to 2010 . DT Sahel region , in particular , will experience higher average temperatures over DT course of DT 21st century and changes in rainfall patterns , according to DT Intergovernmental Panel on NNP NNP ( IPCC ) . NN NN , and resulting in increased temperatures , storms , droughts , and rising NN levels , will affect DT incidence and distribution of infectious NN across DT globe . [ 87 ] This is true in Africa , where malaria continues to have dramatic effects on DT population . As NN NN continues , DT specific areas likely to experience DT NN - round , high - risk transmission of malaria will shift from coastal West Africa to an area between DT Democratic Republic of DT Congo and Uganda , known as DT African Highlands . [ 88 ] To understand DT exposures WDT affect shifting malaria transmission rates PRP can look to DT Epidemiologic Triad , a model WDT explains DT relationship between exposure , transmission , and causation of infectious diseases . [ 89 ] With regards to malaria transmission rates in DT African Highlands , factors and exposures resulting from drastic environmental changes IN warmer climates , shifts in weather patterns , and increases in human impact such as deforestation , provide appropriate conditions for malaria transmission between carrier and host . [ 90 ] Because of this , vectors will adapt , thrive , and multiply at a fast pace . An increase in DT number of vectors WDT carry parasites , microbes , and pathogens WDT cause NN will become a NN hazard for DT human population . [ 87 ] Specifically , malaria is caused by DT Plasmodium falciparum and Plasmodium vivax parasites which are carried by DT vector Anopheles mosquito . Even though DT Plasmodium vivax parasite can survive in lower temperatures , DT Plasmodium falciparum parasite will only survive and replicate in DT mosquito when NN temperatures are above 20 ℃ . [ 91 ] Increases in humidity and rain RB contribute to DT replication and survival of this infectious agent . , [ 92 ] Increasing JJ temperatures combined with changes in land cover as a result of extreme deforestation will create ideal habitats for mosquitoes to survive in DT African Highlands . If deforestation continues at its current rate , more land will be available for mosquito breeding grounds , and DT population of mosquitos will rapidly increase . DT increase in mosquitoes will thus increase DT opportunity for both Plasmodium falciparum and Plasmodium vivax parasites to proliferate . Exposure to malaria will become a greater risk to humans as DT number of female Anopheles mosquitos infected with either DT Plasmodium falciparum or Plasmodium vivax parasite increases . [ 92 ] DT mosquito will transmit DT parasite to DT human host through a bite , resulting in infection . Then , when an uninfected mosquito bites DT now infected human host , DT parasite will be transmitted to DT mosquitoes which will then become an exposure to other uninfected human hosts . Individuals who are constantly exposed to DT Malaria parasite due to multiple bites by mosquitoes WDT carry DT parasite are at greater risk of dying . [ 91 ] Infected humans can RB transmit DT NN to uninfected or healthy humans via contaminated blood . [ 91 ] DT NN effects caused by shifts in malaria transmission rates in DT African Highlands have DT potential to be severe . Research has shown IN DT effects of NN NN on NN will impact most populations over DT next few decades . [ 93 ] However , Africa , and specifically DT African Highlands , are susceptible to being particularly negatively affected . In 2010 , 91 % of DT JJ burden due to malaria deaths occurred in Africa . Several spatiotemporal models have been studied to assess DT potential effect of projected NN scenarios on malaria transmission in Africa . A NN conducted by Caminade et al . [ 94 ] concluded IN DT most significant NN NN effects are confined to specific regions , including DT African Highlands . These results are consistent with previous studies . Ultimately , studies show an overall increase in NN suitability for malaria transmission resulting in an increase in DT population at risk of contracting DT NN . [ 94 ] Of significant importance is DT increase of epidemic potential at higher altitudes ( IN DT African Highlands ) . Rising temperatures in these areas have DT potential to VB normally non-malarial areas to areas with seasonal epidemics . [ 95 ] Consequently , JJ populations will be exposed to DT NN resulting in healthy NNS lost . In addition , DT NN burden MD be more detrimental to areas WDT lack DT ability and resources to effectively respond to such challenges and stresses . [ 96 ] Scientific limitations when examining shifting malaria transmission rates in DT African Highlands are similar to those related to broader understandings of NN NN and malaria . While modeling with temperature changes shows IN EX is a relationship between an increase in temperature and an increase in malaria transmission , limitations still exist . Future population shifts WDT affect population density , as well as changes in DT behavior of mosquitos , can affect transmission rates and are limiting factors in determining DT future risk of malaria outbreaks , which RB affect planning for correct outbreak response preparation . [ 88 ] DT challenges of controlling and possibly eradicating malaria in DT African Highlands are JJ and varied . JJ of DT strategies used to control malaria have not changed , are few in number and have rarely been added to in DT last 20 NNS . DT most common forms of control are educating DT NN and vector control . DT huge geographic area of DT vectors Anopheles is possibly DT largest challenge faced in DT control of malaria . With such a large area to cover PRP is hard to use insecticides at a continuous and effective level . [ 97 ] This form of control is expensive , and DT areas affected are not able to sustain control . Without sustained control , a rapid resurgence in parasite transmission is seen . Another challenge with insecticides is IN DT vector is now becoming insecticide - resistant . Due to DT fact IN mosquitoes have several generations per NN , resistance is seen very quickly . [ 97 ] Education has its limitations as well , as DT population most affected by malaria are NNS , and DT educational message is to stay inside during peak mosquito activity . DT low socioeconomic status of DT NNS who inhabit DT African Highlands is RB a challenge . Local NN facilities have limited resources , and poor living conditions and malnourishment exacerbate malaria symptoms and increase DT likelihood of death due to malaria . [ 97 ] As NN NN shifts geographic areas of transmission to DT African Highlands , DT challenge will be to find and control DT vector in areas WDT have not seen PRP before , and to not waste resources on areas where DT temperature is no longer conducive to parasite growth . [ 98 ] DT solutions WDT can help malaria control and possibly lead to eradication are far fewer in number than DT challenges , but if PRP are effective PRP can truly VB DT areas currently affected . EX are number of groups working on a NN , some are looking to control DT transmission of DT parasite to DT host , or control transmission from human back to DT vector . [ 99 ] These NNS are not very effective currently , and lose their effectiveness over NN , so are not ideal . But , DT development is still progressing in DT hopes of finding a better , more effective long - lasting NN . [ 99 ] An alternative to NNS is vectored immunoprophylaxis ( VIP ) WDT is a form a gene therapy . This therapy will VB cells in DT host WDT will secrete antigens from various stages of DT parasite in DT hopes of triggering an anamnestic immune response in DT recipient and prevent NN and parasite transmission . [ 100 ] DT policy implications of NN NN and malaria rates in DT African Highlands are RB vast , and ultimately fall into two categories : • Enacting policy WDT will reduce greenhouse gas NNS , thus slowing down NN NN , and • Mitigating problems WDT have already arisen , and will inevitably continue to develop , due to NN NN . [ 101 ] Addressing both of these areas is of great importance , as those in DT poorest NNS , including NNS WDT make up DT African Highlands , face DT greatest burden . Additionally , when NNS are forced to contend with a NN IN malaria , their prospects for JJ growth are slowed . This contributes to continued and worsening JJ inequality . [ 102 ] When addressing policy WDT will reduce greenhouse gas NNS , PRP is necessary to act on a JJ scale , even when related effects are narrowed to a smaller area . DT 2015 Lancet Commission on NNP and NNP NNP made nine recommendations for governments to address . These include : • Support cities WDT encourage healthy activities for individuals and DT NN . • Increase access to renewable NN in low to middle - income NNS . • Quantify avoided burdens when these measures are taken . • Create an agreement WDT will help counties making changes to become low - carbon economies . [ 101 ] When PRP focuses on mitigation , specifically as PRP relates to malaria in DT African Highlands , research is still an important component . This research needs to take JJ forms , including attribution studies , to help clarify DT degree to which malaria rates are attributed to NN NN ; scenario modeling , which can help further our understanding of future NN NN consequences on malaria rates ; and examinations of intervention programs and techniques , to help our understanding of what appropriate responses are . [ 102 ] Surveillance and monitoring of malaria in populations in DT African Highlands will RB be important , to better understand NN . [ 101 ] Beyond these research priorities , PRP is RB important IN PRP enact policies WDT will significantly increase investments in JJ NN in DT African Highlands . This achieves two goals , DT first being better outcomes related to malaria in DT affected area , and DT second being an overall better NN environment for populations . [ 101 ] PRP is RB important to focus on “ CD - NN approaches . " [ 101 ] This means collaborating on an interdisciplinary level , across various geographic areas , to come up with workable solutions . These policies can be seen in action in DT NNP NNP Organization 's “ Adaptation to NNP NNP in Africa Plan of Action for DT NNP Sector 2012 - 2016 . " [ 103 ] This report “ is intended to provide a comprehensive and evidence - based coordinated response of DT NN sector to NN NN adaptation needs of African NNS in order to support DT commitments and priorities of African governments . " [ 103 ] DT action plan includes goals IN scaling up JJ NN activities , coordinating efforts on an international scale , strengthening partnerships and collaborative efforts , and promoting research on both DT effects of NN NN as well as effective measures taken in local communities to mitigate NN NN consequences . [ 103 ] • Scientific Understanding of East African NN NN from DT HyCRISTAL project

In DT clip , DT band rally against NN NN and paint a picture of a dystopian future . • Read more : Savages ’ drummer and Music Declares Emergency co-founder Fay Milton on NN NN : “ Music needs to VB real ” DT video for ‘ NNP Lightning ’ has premiered on DT website for Music Declares Emergency , DT organisation set up by members of DT music NN to tackle NN NN within DT industry . Watch DT JJ video below . Foals have been very open about their passion for campaigning against NN NN . I was talking to her about Extinction Rebellion then PRP signed up to Music Declares Emergency . “ PRP ’d been carbon offsetting before DT and PRP ’d been aware of environmental problems . PRP ’s definitely disturbed me for a while , DT ’s why a lot of DT lyrics on these two records pertain to DT . ” He continued : “ On DT day of DT Mercury Prize , PRP thought PRP MD be good to bring exposure to Music Declares and just to VB DT sentiment across . PRP ’s easy to VB , ‘ Oh , everyone knows what ’s VBG on with DT environment and everyone ’s making changes ’ , but PRP ’s CD of those echo chamber things where PRP forget IN actually lots of NNS either do n’t care , do n’t believe PRP or do n’t act upon PRP . ” NME recently spoke to Fay Milton about DT organisation and what DT music industry can do to combat NN NN . “ EX ’s such a short period of NN to make DT changes PRP need to make , and to make NNS wake up and realise IN EX is n’t NN for everyone to VB everything PRP do , ” she VBD . “ To use Greta Thunberg ’s analogy , DT house is on fire , and EX is n’t NN for whoever started DT fire with their cigarette to quit smoking before saying DT house is on fire – PRP ’s on fire now , and PRP need to fix this . Let ’s VB our lifestyles , let ’s fly less , let ’s use less plastic – but ultimately what ’s needed is a governmental response . ” Foals RB released a JJ live film called Rip Up DT Road . In an NME review of DT film , James McMahon VBD : “ Rip Up DT Road is a film where PRP VBP DT opportunity to understand Foals in a way PRP ’ve never done before . “ Simultaneously PRP gives DT band a canvas to do DT same about themselves . text: DT 2013 EU strategy on adaptation to NN NN aims at contributing to a more NN - resilient Europe . However , EX are still large gaps in understanding and characterising NN impacts in Europe and how impacts in DT rest of DT NN MD affect Europe . This report provides quantitative modelling - based results from biophysical and agro-economic models as part of DT PESETA - IV ( Projection of JJ impacts of NN NN in Sectors of DT European Union based on bottom - up Analysis ) project . PRP analyse NN NN projections for 2050 considering DT Representative Concentration Pathway ( RCP ) of 8.5 W/m2 ( with corresponding JJ NN levels ranging between 1.6 oC and 2.7 oC compared to pre-industrial levels ) , as well as for 1.5 °C and 2 °C NN conditions . Results show IN NN NN will pose a threat to JJ food production in DT medium to long term , and IN Europe will RB be affected . Forced by DT projected changes in daily temperature , precipitation , wind , relative humidity , and JJ radiation , grain maize yields in DT EU will decline between 1 % and 22 % . In addition , wheat yields in Southern Europe are expected to decrease by up to 49 % . However , in Northern Europe some of DT negative productivity effects caused by NN NN MD be partially offset by higher levels of atmospheric CO2 concentrations and changing precipitation regimes . Losses , especially in Southern Europe MD be reduced by tailored adaptation strategies ; e.g. changing varieties and crop types , increasing and improving irrigation practices for certain crops and when economically feasible . However , limitations on sustainable NN abstraction levels MD become a barrier to increase irrigation levels , specifically in DT Mediterranean NNS ( particularly Spain , Portugal , Greece , Cyprus , Malta , Italy and Turkey ) where duration of NN scarcity under JJ NN are projected to intensify . As large negative NN NN impacts on productivity outside of DT EU are estimated , large market spill - over effects will push up production in both Northern and Southern Europe through higher demand for some agricultural commodities outside of EU , resulting in higher producer prices . This , in turn , MD benefit farmers ' income and have positive effects on DT EU ’s agricultural commodity exports . However , other limiting factors ( not all fully integrated into DT used modelling system yet ) , such as increasing NN shortage in Southern Europe ( Task 10 ) and constraints on DT expansion of irrigation , increasing impacts of heatwaves and droughts , consequences of reduction of nutrient use due to environmental and NN mitigation constraints , need to be further evaluated .

text: A highly qualified and experienced NN modeler with impeccable credentials has rejected DT unscientific bases of DT doom - mongering over a purported NN crisis . His work has not yet been picked up in this country , but DT is about to VB . Writing at DT Australian site Quadrant , Tony Thomas introduces DT English - speaking NN to DT truth - telling of Dr. Mototaka Nakamura ( hat tip : Andrew Bolt , John McMahon ) . EX ’s a top - level oceanographer and meteorologist who is prepared to cry “ Nonsense ! ” on DT “ JJ NN crisis ” evident to NN modellers but not in DT real NN . He ’s as well or better qualified than DT modellers he criticises — DT ones whose NN 2100 forebodings of 4degC NN have set DT NN to spending $ US1.5 trillion a NN to combat CO2 NNS . DT iconoclast is Dr. Mototaka Nakamura . In June he put out a small book in Japanese on “ DT sorry NN of NN NN ” . PRP ’s titled Confessions of a NN scientist : DT JJ NN hypothesis is an unproven hypothesis , and he is very much qualified to take a stand . From 1990 to 2014 he worked on cloud dynamics and forces mixing atmospheric and ocean flows on medium to planetary scales . His bases were MIT ( for a Doctor of NNP in meteorology ) , Georgia Institute of Technology , Goddard Space Flight Centre , Jet Propulsion Laboratory , Duke and Hawaii Universities and DT Japan Agency for Marine - NNP NNP and Technology . He ’s published about 20 NN papers on fluid dynamics . [ i ] Today ’s vast panoply of “ JJ NN NN ” is IN an upside down pyramid built on DT work of a few score of serious NN modellers . PRP claim to have demonstrated human - derived CO2 NNS as DT cause of recent JJ NN and project IN NN forward . Every orthodox NN researcher takes such output from DT modellers ’ black boxes as a given . Dr. Nakamura has just made his work available to DT English - speaking NN : And DT critique he offers is comprehensive . Now Nakamura has found PRP again , further accusing DT orthodox NNS of “ data falsification ” by adjusting previous temperature data to increase apparent NN “ DT JJ surface mean temperature - NN data no longer have any scientific value and are nothing except a propaganda tool to DT NN , ” he writes . DT NN models are useful tools for academic studies , he says . However , “ DT models just become useless pieces of junk or worse ( worse in a sense IN PRP can produce gravely misleading output ) when PRP are used for NN forecasting . ” DT reason : These models completely lack some critically important NN processes and feedbacks , and represent some other critically important NN processes and feedbacks in grossly distorted manners to DT extent WDT makes these models totally useless for any meaningful NN prediction . I myself used to use NN simulation models for scientific studies , not for predictions , and learned about their problems and limitations in DT process . NN forecasting is simply impossible , if only because future changes in solar NN output are unknowable . As to DT impacts of human - caused CO2 , PRP ca n’t be judged “ with DT knowledge and technology PRP currently possess . ” # A complete lack of meaningful representations of aerosol changes WDT generate clouds . # Lack of understanding of drivers of NN - albedo ( reflectivity ) feedbacks : “ Without a reasonably accurate representation , PRP is impossible to make any meaningful predictions of NN variations and changes in DT middle and high latitudes and thus DT entire NN . ” # Arbitrary “ tunings ” ( fudges ) of key parameters WDT are not understood Concerning CO2 changes he says , I VBP to point out a simple fact IN PRP is impossible to correctly predict even DT sense or direction of a NN of a system when DT prediction tool lacks and / or grossly distorts important non-linear processes , feedbacks in particular , WDT are present in DT actual system … … DT real or realistically - simulated NN system is far more complex than an absurdly simple system simulated by DT toys WDT have been used for NN predictions to date , and will be insurmountably difficult for those naïve NN researchers who have zero or very limited understanding of geophysical fluid dynamics . I understand geophysical fluid dynamics just a little , but enough to realize IN DT dynamics of DT atmosphere and oceans are absolutely critical facets of DT NN system if PRP hopes to ever make any meaningful prediction of NN variation . Solar input , absurdly , is modelled as a “ never changing quantity ” . He says , “ PRP has only been several decades since PRP acquired an ability to accurately monitor DT incoming solar NN . In these several decades only , PRP has varied by CD to two watts per square metre . Is PRP reasonable to assume IN PRP will not vary any more than DT in DT next hundred NNS or longer for forecasting purposes ? I MD say , No . ” EX is much , much more . Read DT whole thing . But who are PRP VBG to believe : a superbly qualified Japanese scientist or a Swedish teenager with mental issues ?

text: Dr. Houghton ’s other books include “ JJ NN : DT Complete Briefing , ” first published in 1994 , and “ Does God Play Dice ? A Look at DT Story of DT Universe ” ( 1988 ) . He married Margaret Broughton in 1962 ; she died in 1986 . In 1988 , he married Sheila Thompson . In addition to his granddaughter Hannah , he is survived by his wife ; two NNS from his first marriage , Peter Houghton and Janet Malcolm ; a younger brother , Paul ; and six other grandchildren . An older brother , David , died in 2015 . In recent NNS Dr. Houghton had retired to DT Welsh seaside and was fading into dementia , Hannah Malcolm VBD , adding : “ But DT NN remained with him . A good life . ” As a leader of DT I.P.C.C. , he had DT skills of a statesman , VBD Jean - Pascal van Ypersele of DT Université Catholique de Louvain in Belgium . He recalled watching Dr. Houghton co-chair a meeting in 1995 in Madrid WDT led to a statement IN DT smoking gun of NN NN had been found : DT influence of human activities on NN was becoming discernible in observations of DT present , not just in projections of DT future . “ Fossil fuel companies and oil - dependent NNS were intensely lobbying at DT I.P.C.C. meeting to try to dilute DT message , ” Dr. van Ypersele VBD . Is PRP because powerful proponents of JJ depopulation serve in DT most powerful political positions in DT NN ? Have n't PRP seen this before ? Do PRP really VB to see PRP again ? How these questions are answered is entirely up to PRP . This textbook is being used to teach NNS IN chemical aerosols are harmless NN vapor " condensation trails " , but this is blatantly false . Jet engines do not produce condensation trails except under extremely rare conditions , and these will be too short and too high to be seen from DT group . In fact , most NNS will never see a true condensation trail in their entire lives . JJ skywatchers and airline pilots have come forward to express their disdain about DT blatant disinformation being told to DT NN regarding contrail formation . Below is an excerpt from DT school textbook entitled " Weather Studies " . PRP have provided photos and a transcript of chapter 7 which is entitled " Clouds , Prescription , and Weather Radar " . A familiar sight in DT daytime sky almost anywhere is contrails , bright white streamers of NN crystals WDT form in DT exhaust of jet aircraft ( Figure 7.1 ) . Contrails are modifying DT cloud cover along heavily traveled air corridors between major urban areas with possible implications for weather and NN . According to some studies , contrails already cover about 5 % of DT sky in some portions of DT eastern NNP NNPS . A contrail , short for condensation trail , develops when DT hot humid air in jet engine exhaust mixes with DT cold , drier air at high altitudes . Turbulence in DT exhaust causes DT mixing . A similar process enables PRP to “ see our breath ” when PRP exhale on a cold winter day . For details on this process , see this chapter ’s first Essay , “ Clouds by Mixing . ” Depending on atmospheric conditions , contrails MD dissipate ( sublimate ) within minutes or hours , or PRP MD spread laterally forming wispy cirrus clouds WDT persist for a day or so . Atmospheric NNS hypothesized IN increased cloud cover caused by contrails MD effect DT local radiation budget in two ways : During daylight hours , contrails and their cirrus byproducts incoming solar radiation thereby cooling NNP ’s surface . At night , contrails and associated cirrus clouds absorb and emit infrared radiation welling up from below thereby enhancing DT greenhouse effect and elevating NNP ’s surface temperature . Cooler days and warmer nights reduces DT diurnal temperature range ( DTR ) , DT difference between DT day ’s maximum and minimum temperatures . Furthermore , contrails MD stimulate precipitation locally by supplying NN crystal nuclei for lower clouds . NNS had an opportunity to test their hypothesis regarding DT impact of contrails on DT radiation budget immediately after DT terrorist attacks of 11 September 2001 when DT Federal Aviation Administration ( FAA ) ordered a three - day shutdown of all commercial air traffic in DT NNP NNPS . Almost immediately , contrails began to dissipate . David J. Travis , a NN scientist at DT University of Wisconsin - Whitewater , and colleagues at Pennsylvania NNP University analyzed DT effects of a contrail - free sky on surface temperatures at 4,000 U.S. weather stations . PRP found IN DT DTR during DT three - day period was about 1.1 - Celsius degree ( 2 Fahrenheit degrees ) higher than DT long - term ( 30 - NN ) average . Furthermore , DT DTR for DT three - day periods preceding and following DT shutdown was below DT long - term average . These observations support DT hypothesis IN contrails MD contribute to NN NN by making days colder and nights warmer . With DT expected future increase in JJ aircraft traffic , some NNS expect DT contribution of contrails to NN NN to become more significant ; DT average contrail sky coverage expected to more than double by 2050 . At this point , PRP is not known whether more contrails will have a net NN or cooling effect on JJ NN . Driving Question : How do clouds and precipitation form ! Clouds whisk across DT sky in ever - changing patterns of white and gray ; fog lends an eerie silence to a dreary day . Clouds and fog are products of condensation or deposition of NN vapor within DT atmosphere . Most clouds are DT consequence of saturation brought about by uplift and expansional cooling of air . Fog is a cloud WDT forms near , or in contact , with NNP ’s surface ; most fogs develop when DT lowest layer of air is chilled to saturation via radiational or advective cooling . Cloud formation is an essential part of DT JJ NN cycle because without clouds EX MD be no rain or snow . And yet most clouds — even those associated with large storm systems — do not produce precipitation . DT principal subjects of this chapter are DT development and classification of clouds and fog , plus DT formation and types of precipitation . PRP RB examine weather radar , a valuable tool for locating and tracking areas of precipitation and for monitoring air motion within weather systems . This chapter closes with a summary of DT various direct and remote methods for measuring precipitation . NN vapor is an invisible component of air , but its condensation and deposition products ( NN droplets and NN crystals ) are visible . A cloud is DT visible product of condensation or deposition of NN vapor within DT atmosphere ; PRP consists of an aggregate of minute NN droplets and / or NN crystals suspended in DT atmosphere . This section covers DT process of cloud development . Clouds are increasingly likely to form as air nears saturation . But when NNS try to simulate this process in DT laboratory using a clean - air chamber , a cloud does not form even if DT relative humidity is elevated well above 100 % , DT is , to supersaturation values . A clean - air chamber is an enclosed container of air from which all solid and liquid particles ( aerosols ) have been filtered out . Introducing NN vapor into DT chamber raises DT relative humidity , but even if DT relative humidity is elevated to as high as 200 % , no cloud forms . How is DT possible ? PRP expect IN once air becomes saturated ( relative to a flat - NN surface ) , condensation MD initially produce extremely small droplets and those droplets MD eventually grow into cloud droplets through additional condensation . However , droplets will not form in DT first place unless DT relative humidity rises to extraordinarily high levels of supersaturation . Tiny droplets cannot form in a cloud chamber without a supersaturated environment because of DT so - called curvature effect . DT curvature of a NN surface affects DT ability of NN molecules to escape ( vaporize ) from DT NN surface . DT smaller DT droplet , DT greater is DT concentration of surrounding NN vapor WDT is necessary for DT droplet to grow . DT curvature of DT surface of a spherical NN droplet increases as DT radius of DT droplet decreases ; DT is , DT surface of a small droplet has a greater curvature than DT surface of a large droplet . ( At DT limit , a flat - NN surface has no curvature . ) With increasing curvature , molecules WDT form DT surface of a droplet have fewer neighboring molecules and are more weakly bonded . Molecules composing a flat - NN surface have DT most neighboring molecules and are most strongly bonded . Bond strength affects DT flux of NN molecules from DT liquid to vapor phase . For this reason , NN molecules more readily escape a NN droplet than a flat - NN surface and NN molecules more readily escape a small NN droplet than a large NN droplet . Consequently , at DT same temperature , DT saturation vapor pressure surrounding a small NN droplet is greater than DT surrounding a large droplet . Values of saturation vapor pressure listed in Table 6.3 are defined for air over a flat surface of fresh NN and are DT basis for computing relative humidity ( Chapter 6 ) . DT saturation vapor pressure increases with increasing curvature ( and decreasing droplet size ) . For droplets having a radius of 0.001 micrometer , DT saturation vapor pressure at a given temperature is about 3.4 times DT specified in Table 6.3 , which computes to a relative humidity of 340 % . On DT other hand , for droplets having a radius greater than 1.0 micrometer , DT difference between DT saturation vapor pressure surrounding DT droplet and DT values listed in Table 6.3 is minimal and computes to a relative humidity only slightly higher than 100 % . DT bottom line : In clean air , NN vapor will not condense into tiny NN droplets unless DT air is supersaturated to very high levels . In DT real atmosphere , DT relative humidity never even approaches such great supersaturation values , so tiny droplets cannot form or grow . What then makes cloud formation possible ? DT clean - air chamber experiment described above failed to produce a cloud because DT air was not sufficiently supersaturated . In DT real atmosphere , supersaturated air is not needed for clouds to develop ; in fact , cloud droplets readily form as DT relative humidity nears 100 % . And clouds are abundant ; at any given NN , about 60 % of DT NN is shrouded in clouds . How then , do cloud droplets form ? DT answer : PRP have a head start . Suspended in air are solid and liquid particles WDT provide relatively large surface areas on which condensation or deposition initially takes place . These naturally occurring particles WDT promote condensation or deposition in DT atmosphere are known as nuclei . Nuclei have radii greater than 1.0 micrometer and favor condensation ( or deposition ) of NN vapor . Once condensation ( or deposition ) starts , PRP become comparably sized cloud droplets ( or NN crystals ) . Additional growth of these droplets ( or NN crystals ) by condensation ( or deposition ) is more likely because PRP can grow in an environment with a relative humidity WDT exceeds 100 % by only 1 % or so . Most cloud particles have radii of 2 to 10 micrometers . ­­ Nuclei , essential for cloud formation , are abundant in DT atmosphere and are continually cycled into DT atmosphere from NNP ’s surface . Sources of nuclei include volcanic eruptions , wind erosion of soil , forest fires , and ocean spray . When NN waves break , drops of salt NN enter DT atmosphere and DT NN evaporates leaving behind tiny sea-salt crystals WDT function as nuclei ( Figure 7.2 ) . NNS from domestic and industrial chimneys RB contribute nuclei to DT atmosphere . Depending on DT product ( liquid NN droplets or NN crystals ) , a distinction is made between cloud condensation nuclei and NN - forming nuclei . Cloud condensation nuclei ( CCN ) promote condensation of NN vapor at temperatures both above and below DT freezing point of NN . Within DT atmosphere , NN vapor can condense into cloud droplets WDT remain liquid even at temperatures well below 00 C ( 320 F ) . Droplets at such temperatures are described as supercooled . NN - forming nuclei ( IN ) are much less common than CCNs and promote formation of NN crystals only at temperatures well below freezing . DT most efficient NN - forming nuclei are substances having a crystal structure similar to DT of NN and most are almost insoluble in NN . Clayey soil particles are excellent NN - forming nuclei . DT two types of NN - forming nuclei are freezing nuclei and deposition nuclei . Freezing nuclei are particles on which NN vapor condenses and subsequently freezes ; PRP are active at temperatures below about - 90 C ( 160 F ) . Hygroscopic nuclei are a special category of cloud condensation nuclei because PRP possess a chemical attraction for NN molecules . Condensation begins on hygroscopic nuclei at a relative humidity under 100 % . Magnesium chloride ( MgCl2 ) , a salt in sea-spray , can promote condensation at a relative humidity as low as 70 % ! Clouds form more efficiently where hygroscopic nuclei are abundant . JJ sources of hygroscopic nuclei exist in urban - industrial areas and this helps explain why localities downwind of large cities tend to be somewhat cloudier and rainier than upwind localities . DT Metropolitan Meteorological Experiment ( METROMEX ) conducted in DT 1970s demonstrated IN DT average summer rainfall was 5 % to 25 % greater within , and up to 50 to 75 km ( 31 to 47 mi ) downwind of St. Louis , MO than upwind of DT city . In more recent NNS , similar urban effects on precipitation were detected in Tokyo , Phoenix , and other cities . Besides being a source of hygroscopic nuclei , cities RB spur cloud and precipitation development by contributing NN vapor ( raising DT relative humidity ) and heat ( adding to DT buoyancy of air ) . Furthermore , DT relative roughness of a city surface induces convergence of horizontal winds , uplift of air , and expansional cooling ( Chapter 8 ) . Interestingly , not all NN crystals form on DT traditional nuclei described above . While sampling NN crystals in cold clouds from aircraft , NNS discovered IN DT concentration of NN crystals is highly variable within DT cloud and NN crystals are 10 to 1,000 times more numerous than nuclei . This discrepancy is likely explained by DT presence of fragments of NN crystals WDT break off during midair collisions . These NN fragments then function as additional nuclei . text: As DT NNP continues to see protest groups take to DT streets and demand radical NN in how PRP treat our environment , calling for DT end of fossil fuels and a push for renewable NN sources PRP have to ask yourself what are DT trade offs , what real benefit will these so called greener and cleaner NN sources provide for PRP ? Well , if an article by Jason Hickel in Foreign Policy , with DT sub - title “ If DT NN is n’t careful , renewable NN MD become as destructive as fossil fuels . ” is anything to VB by EX is very real reasons to be concerned ! Here is DT opening few paragraphs from DT article : DT conversation about NN NN has been blazing ahead in recent months . Propelled by DT school NN strikes and social movements IN Extinction Rebellion , a number of governments have declared a NN emergency , and progressive political parties are making plans — at last — for a rapid transition to clean NN under DT banner of DT Green NNP Deal . This is a welcome shift , and PRP need more of PRP . But a JJ problem is beginning to emerge WDT warrants our attention . Some proponents of DT Green NNP Deal seem to believe IN PRP will pave DT way to a utopia of “ green growth . ” Once PRP trade dirty fossil fuels for clean NN , EX ’s no reason PRP can’t keep expanding DT economy forever . This narrative MD seem reasonable enough at first glance , but EX are good reasons to VB twice about PRP . CD of them has to do with clean NN itself . DT phrase “ clean NN ” normally conjures up happy , innocent images of warm sunshine and fresh wind . But while sunshine and wind is obviously clean , DT infrastructure PRP need to capture PRP is not . Far from PRP . DT transition to renewables is VBG to require a dramatic increase in DT extraction of metals and rare - NN minerals , with real ecological and social costs . In 2017 , DT NNP Bank released a little - noticed report WDT offered DT first comprehensive look at this question . PRP models DT increase in material extraction WDT MD be required to build enough solar and wind utilities to produce an annual output of about 7 terawatts of electricity by 2050 . DT ’s enough to power roughly half of DT JJ economy . By doubling DT NNP Bank figures , PRP can estimate what PRP will take to VB all DT way to zero NNS — and DT results are staggering : 34 million metric tons of copper , 40 million tons of lead , 50 million tons of zinc , 162 million tons of aluminum , and no less than 4.8 billion tons of iron . So DT question is this , are PRP really moving to cleaner and greener forms of NN sources , or are PRP merely creating JJ problems to remove another ? Material extraction is a costly business , both financially and more importantly environmentally . text: DT summer of 1540 was burning hot in DT vine - covered hills of Burgundy , France — so hot as to be “ almost unbearable , ” according to CD written account from DT NN . In fact , PRP was hot all across Europe DT NN . In DT Alps , glaciers melted , their snouts retreating up steep - sided valleys . Fires burned from France to Poland . And in DT wine country of central France , DT grapes withered to raisins on DT vine , so DT wine made from them was syrupy and extra-alcoholic . Normally , winemakers harvested grapes at DT very end of September or early October . But DT NN , PRP had to scurry to VB overripe grapes off DT vine weeks earlier than usual . Now , a nearly 700 - NN - long record of harvest dates from DT town of Beaune , in Burgundy , shows IN early harvest dates IN DT NN from 1540 are now par for DT course , thanks to NN NN . NNS and historians stitched together a record of grape harvest dates VBG back to 1354 . PRP found IN air temperatures have warmed so much — and especially in DT last 30 NNS — IN grapes are now harvested almost two weeks before their historical norm . “ PRP can clearly see DT reaction of DT grapes to DT rise in temperature , ” says Thomas Labbé , an historian at DT University of Leipzig . And DT reaction is changing DT wine itself . Wine , in Burgundy , is built into DT fabric of DT culture . DT pinot noir and chardonnay grapes DT region is known for have been growing RB and adapting to DT precise NN conditions of DT region for centuries . Winemakers VBP DT growth stages intimately : DT look of DT vines before PRP bud ; DT look of DT vines as PRP mature over long seasons ; and DT fat , sugary , fragrant curve of DT grapes when PRP ’re ready to be made into wine . DT harvest point is crucial . Too long on DT vine and DT grapes have too much sugar in them , meaning DT wine will be more alcoholic — not DT subtle feel most winemakers in DT region care for . Too long , and DT acids WDT give wine some of its feel in DT mouth MD disintegrate . Not long enough , and PRP might not have developed DT right balance of fragrant chemicals WDT give DT wine its characteristic flavours . Winemakers keep careful track of harvest dates , with some records stretching back to DT Middle Ages . In DT 1800s , NNS and historians realised IN those careful records MD be used to keep track of how DT NN in different parts of Europe has changed over NN . “ Grape harvest date records are DT longest records of phonology in Europe , ” says Elizabeth Wolkovich , a biologist at DT University of British Columbia who studies wine and NN relationships . “ PRP have these hundreds of NNS of records of what DT summer temp was JJ , and PRP can use them IN a thermometer . ” Grape harvest dates reflect DT temperature DT grapes have felt over DT course of DT growing season , from about April until PRP ’re picked . If DT spring and summer are hot , DT grapes mature faster and need to be picked sooner . If PRP 're cool , DT opposite is true . NN historians started to pull together ancient information from other sources , too . PRP matched up DT patterns in DT grape harvest data with records made from tree rings and DT length of glaciers in DT Alps . PRP used records IN those to figure out IN much of central Europe warmed up during DT Medieval Warm Period , from around 900 to 1300 . PRP had cooled down during DT Little NNP Age , from about DT 15th to DT 19th centuries . DT historians saw IN over DT past few hundred NNS , temperatures wobbled around , skewing warm for short stretches and cooling down in others . But overall , NN rocked up and down around a fairly consistent average value — until recently .

text: ( CNN ) DT NNP is heading toward a " JJ tipping point " if DT NN crisis continues on its current path , NNS have warned , as PRP called for urgent action to avoid " an existential threat to civilization . " DT group of researchers , who published a commentary in DT journal Nature , say EX is growing evidence to suggest IN irreversible changes to DT NNP 's environmental systems are already taking place , and IN PRP are now in a " NN of planetary emergency . " A JJ tipping point is a threshold when DT NN 's systems VBP beyond DT point of no return -- such as DT loss of DT Amazon rainforest , accelerated melting of NN sheets , and thawing of permafrost -- DT authors of DT commentary say . Such a collapse MD lead to " hothouse " conditions WDT MD make some areas on NNP uninhabitable . " PRP argue IN DT intervention NN left to prevent tipping MD already have shrunk towards zero , whereas DT reaction NN to achieve net zero NNS is 30 NNS at best , " DT authors VBD . Led by Timothy Lenton , professor of NN NN and NNP system NN at DT University of Exeter , in southwest England , DT team identified nine areas where PRP say tipping points are already underway . DT team claims IN these events are interconnected and NN in PRP will impact another , causing a worsening " cascade " of crises . DT researchers VBD early results from preliminary models suggest DT NN is much more sensitive than first thought and IN a JJ tipping point is possible . " Research last NN analyzed 30 types of regime shift spanning physical NN and ecological systems , from collapse of DT West Antarctic NN sheet to a switch from rainforest to savanna , " PRP added . " This indicated IN exceeding tipping points in CD system can increase DT risk of crossing them in others . " DT idea of a NN tipping point is not JJ . DT UN Intergovernmental Panel on NNP NNP ( IPCC ) introduced DT concept 20 NNS ago . Back then , DT UN suggested such " large - scale discontinuities " MD only come about when JJ NN exceeded 5 degrees Celsius above pre-industrial levels . But DT authors say data from DT two most recent IPCC reports in 2018 and September 2019 , suggest tipping points can happen between 1 C and 2 C of NN . DT model highlighted DT consequences of how DT interactions between a variety of NN NN factors , such as DT loss or weakening of carbon sinks , forest dieback , NN retreat and increased bacteria respiration , MD combine to form a feedback loop which accelerates NN NN . DT authors acknowledge IN EX are limits to their understanding of NN tipping , and further investigation is needed . But PRP say DT possible impact MD be so huge and " irreversible " IN " to err on DT side of danger is not a responsible option . " In other words , not acting is " too risky to bet against " in their view . And NN is of DT essence . Hope is not lost , however . Researchers say IN mitigating greenhouse gas NNS MD still slow down DT accumulation of these NN impacts . What is needed , PRP say , is urgent international action to cut NNS , slow NN level rise , and to keep NN to 1.5 C . " A saving grace is IN DT rate at which damage accumulates from tipping -- and hence DT risk posed -- MD still be under our control to some extent , " PRP VBD . " DT stability and resilience of our NN is in peril . International action -- not just words -- must reflect this . "

text: NOAA NN : Increase in particles high in NNP ’s atmosphere has offset some recent NN NN A recent increase in DT abundance of particles high in DT atmosphere has offset about a third of DT current NN NN influence of carbon dioxide ( CO2 ) NN during DT past decade , according to a JJ NN led by NOAA and published today in DT online edition of NNP . In DT stratosphere , miles above NNP ’s surface , small , airborne particles reflect sunlight back into space , which leads to a cooling influence at DT ground . These particles are RB called “ aerosols , ” and DT JJ paper explores their recent NN effects — DT reasons behind their increase remain DT subject of ongoing research . “ Since DT NN 2000 , stratospheric aerosols have caused a slower rate of NN NN than PRP MD have seen without them , ” says John Daniel , a physicist at DT NOAA NNP System Research Laboratory ( ESRL ) in Boulder , Colo . and an author of DT JJ NN . In fact PRP say IN DT NN is rapid and doubled in DT decade : PRP then admit PRP do n’t VB DT source of these aerosols but give this speculation : Introducing aerosols into DT upper atmosphere is call SRM for Solar Radiation Management . Here is DT Huges patent describing how PRP is done : ( Link ) A method is disclosed for reducing atmospheric NN due to DT greenhouse effect resulting from a greenhouse gases layer . DT method comprises DT step of seeding DT greenhouse gas layer with a quantity of tiny particles of materials … Such materials can include DT class of materials known as Welsbach materials . DT oxides of metal , e.g. , aluminum oxide , are RB suitable for DT purpose . CD technique proposed to seed DT metallic particles was to add DT tiny particles to DT fuel of jet airliners , so IN DT particles MD be emitted from DT jet engine exhaust while DT airliner was at its cruising altitude . Here is an extensive report on how to do PRP and how much PRP MD cost : Aurora Report So NOAA is showing these aerosols are mysteriously appearing in DT upper atmospher , admit PRP do n’t VB why … yet EX is lots of active political action to spread these same aerosols ….. hmmmm …. So if PRP ’s in DT air , are PRP seeing PRP fall to DT ground ? I mean if PRP are spraying aluminum PRP MD see PRP affecting plants and animals right ? Extremely high quantities of aluminum , barium , strontium , and other metals and chemicals are showing up in rainwater , surface NN and air . In just DT last four NNS , citizens in DT Pacific Northwest ( Northern CA , Oregon ) have taken dozens of tests where DT levels of aluminum , for example , has escalated hundreds of times from DT first tests , which were already unusually high . Some tests of single rain events had elevated nearly 50,000 % from DT original 7 ppb . These tests correspond with DT NN of California ’s own test results … This data matches data from other citizen and environmental groups testing nationwide as well as Europe . Dangerous levels of aluminum , barium and other contaminants have saturated most surface waters in much of DT NNP and all NATO NNS . DT metals found exactly match DT primary elements listed in a host of “ geo-engineering patents ” Patents ( assigned to Hughes Aircraft , DOD , Raytheon , and others ) describe DT specific goal of creating artificial cloud cover ( reflecting , therefore cooling ) , and other forms of weather / NN modification . DT California Air Quality Resources Board has studied aerosols migrating from NNP and these rainwater and air metals ( matching DT patents ) are not present in rain or air approaching our continent .
