text: peculiar theme park in DT Hague celebrates DT history of DT Netherlands through a series of miniature models . DT Madurodam features little canals , old - fashioned windmills , tiny tulips and , amid PRP all , an homage to Royal Dutch Shell , DT oil giant WDT is DT biggest company in DT country and , by revenue , DT second largest publicly traded oil - and - gas company in DT NN . EX ’s a Shell drilling platform , a Shell gas station and a Shell natural - gas field , complete with a drilling rig . DT display is at once odd–energy infrastructure in a NNS ’s theme park–and entirely fitting : Shell has been , for decades , CD of DT most powerful players both in Dutch politics and on DT JJ JJ stage . But DT MD soon VB . As concerns grow over DT existential challenges posed by NN NN , Shell must grapple with its own existential crisis : How should a company WDT generates most of its profits by serving DT NN ’s enormous appetite for oil navigate a long - term future in which shifting political and JJ tides threaten to make fossil fuels obsolete ? DT pressure to abandon oil and gas is already in force . In recent NNS , protesters have swarmed Shell ’s headquarters ; advocates representing 17,000 Dutch citizens have sued DT company ; and powerful investors successfully coerced executives to say PRP will reduce NNS . In 2015 , NNS around DT NN promised to aggressively tackle greenhouse - gas NNS , in order to meet DT target laid out by DT Paris Agreement : goals WDT require buying and burning significantly less oil and gas . Shell CEO Ben van Beurden has a bird ’s - eye view of DT situation from his corner office at DT company ’s JJ headquarters in DT Hague . “ PRP have to figure out what are DT right bets to take in a NN WDT is completely changing because of society ’s concerns around NN NN , ” he says . Projections from NN companies show demand for oil MD peak and fall in DT coming decades ; some outside analyses suggest demand for oil MD plateau as soon as 2025 . Markets are already jittery about DT industry : NN was DT worst - performing sector on DT S&P 500 index in 2019 . In 1980 , DT NN industry represented 28 % of DT index ’s value , according to DT Institute for NNP Economics and Financial Analysis ( IEEFA ) . Last NN , PRP represented less than 5 % . DT shift away from oil looms so large IN Moody ’s warned in 2018 IN DT NN transition represents “ significant business and credit risk ” for oil companies . DT heads of DT Banks of England and France VBD in an op - ed IN any company WDT does not VB strategically to DT JJ NN reality “ will fail to exist . ” On Jan. 14 , Larry Fink , founder and CEO of investment giant BlackRock , wrote in an open letter IN “ NN NN has become a defining factor in companies ’ long - term prospects . ” As oil flirts with DT prospect of decline , NN executives are at odds over what to do . Some firms , IN ExxonMobil , are positioning themselves to squeeze DT last lucrative NNS from DT oil economy while arguing to shareholders IN PRP will be able to sell all their oil . Shell and a handful of others are beginning to adapt . Under van Beurden ’s leadership , Shell is charting a path WDT will allow PRP to continue to profit from oil and gas while simultaneously expanding its plastics business and diversifying into electrical power . By DT 2030s , DT 112 - NN - old fossil - fuel giant wants to become DT NN ’s largest power company . As part of this strategy , Shell has worked to present itself as environmentally friendly . Last NN , PRP committed to reduce its NNS by as much as 3 % by 2021 , and by around 50 % by 2050 , tying its executives ’ compensation to DT cuts . Shell ’s moves earned some applause among environmentalists , but DT Intergovernmental Panel on NNP NNP , DT U.N. ’s NN - NN body , concluded in 2018 IN to keep temperatures from rising to levels WDT MD bring a wide range of catastrophes , NNS must halve their greenhouse - gas NNS by 2030 and hit net - zero NNS by 2050 . DT MD mean more than incrementally reducing NNS ; PRP means keeping vast reserves of oil already discovered in DT ground . Van Beurden ’s strategic response shows IN NNS of political and JJ pressure–especially from governments and investors responding to a sustained JJ outcry–can push even DT most powerful interests to VB . Whether NN activists can harness this mounting pressure to compel Shell and other oil companies to transform DT JJ NN economy MD be DT weightiest question of our NN . Executives at Shell knew decades ago IN burning fossil fuels MD cause DT NN to warm , and IN once NN NN became a JJ issue , their firm MD need to VB . Last NN , I sat down with van Beurden for a wide - ranging interview and asked him how he felt about “ Shell knew , ” DT activist mantra WDT accuses DT company of failing to act on NN NN despite knowing DT consequences . He was sanguine : “ Yeah , PRP knew . Everybody knew , ” he VBD . “ And somehow PRP all ignored PRP . ” In DT 1990s , he explained , Shell publicly acknowledged NN NN and VBD DT NN needed to act to combat DT problem . But at DT NN , neither governments nor consumers seemed too concerned about NNS , and DT demand for oil was growing IN gangbusters to fuel a JJ JJ expansion . So DT company dutifully responded to market demands : PRP produced and sold oil to turn a profit . Nearly three decades later , Shell ’s business model is shifting by DT same market - driven calculus . Despite advertising WDT depicts DT oil giant as environmentally friendly , its decision to reduce reliance on oil is not born of benevolence . PRP ’s reacting to market forces . A 2019 McKinsey report predicts IN declining gas consumption in DT transport sector , because of factors IN fuel efficiency and electrification , MD lead oil demand to begin decreasing in DT early 2030s . “ DT future of NN needs to evolve as something else , ” van Beurden says . “ And PRP find a role for ourselves in PRP . ” DT shift away from oil is not just a macroeconomic calculation . In 2018 , NNP Action 100+ , a powerful group of JJ investors WDT now represents $ 41 trillion in assets , delivered an ultimatum : either Shell committed to short - term NNS - reduction targets , or PRP risked losing DT support of some of its largest shareholders . While NNP Action 100 + held little formal power over Shell , DT investors MD wreak havoc within DT company by opposing management in shareholder votes , a process where shareholders can force management to take specific actions . In an extreme case , DT investors MD ditch their Shell stock –which MD undermine share prices , tank DT company ’s valuation and drag down executive pay . “ Politics might be pretty confused and babbling at DT moment , ” says Anne Simpson , director of JJ governance at CalPERS , DT largest JJ pension fund in DT U.S. , and a steering - committee member at NNP Action 100 + . “ But money talks . ” Meanwhile , a Dutch - led group of investors known as Follow This actually went ahead with a series of activist shareholder resolutions WDT , if PRP had garnered DT support of 75 % of shareholders , MD have required DT company to take aggressive NN action . While DT resolutions failed , DT threat was real . By December 2018 , Shell relented and , a few months later , made DT commitment to reducing NNS as much as 3 % by 2021 . Significantly , DT commitment included end - use NNS : DT company was agreeing to take responsibility not only for its own operations , but RB for how consumers use Shell ’s products . DT activist investors claimed victory . “ DT only reason Shell has made this leap forward is because investors started supporting our resolution , ” Follow This founder Mark van Baal told me . Shell ’s JJ commitment was part of a broader rebranding effort . For decades , Shell and other oil - and - gas companies portrayed themselves to consumers as essential to modern life . Their products power your car and warm your house . But over DT NNS , DT image has soured . DT 2010 BP oil spill and a series of journalistic exposés of DT industry ’s misbehavior stole headlines . Shell faced reports of corruption in Nigeria , where PRP has significant drilling operations , including its alleged complicity in NN human - rights abuses . Organizers say IN in September 2019 , more than 7 million NNS marched around DT globe , skipping school and work to demand IN their governments take action to reduce greenhouse - gas NNS . DT U.K. declared a NN emergency and prominent members of DT U.S. Congress called to eliminate DT country ’s fossil - fuel NNS by 2030 . In July , DT head of OPEC , DT oil cartel WDT in 2018 accounted for more than 40 % of DT NN ’s crude - oil production , called NN activists “ DT greatest threat to our industry . ” Widespread JJ criticism of Big Oil is perhaps especially damaging to Shell . Unlike JJ of its competitors , Shell purchases much of its oil from other companies , then slaps DT Shell brand on PRP , rather than digging DT stuff out of DT ground itself . DT means IN its consumer reputation matters more than , say , Occidental Petroleum’s . Shell RB faces scrutiny as a Netherlands - based company . While U.S. firms IN ExxonMobil contend with a relatively conservative political environment in Texas , Shell is headquartered in DT Hague , a city where PRP ’re more likely to VB hit by a bicycle than a car . In Amsterdam , 40,000 NNS took to DT streets last spring to demand action on NN NN , and some protesters carried signs with a version of DT Shell logo fashioned into a middle finger . In London , protesters demonstrated outside Shell ’s offices , graffitiing DT walls with slogans IN crime scene and Shell kills . “ Their own company is built on DT death and destruction of nature and of NNS all around DT NN , ” says Farhana Yamin , a lawyer turned activist who glued herself to DT cement outside Shell ’s London headquarters last April . DT National Theatre in London dropped Shell as a sponsor in October , just as PRP declared a “ NN emergency , ” and DT Dutch branch of Friends of DT NNP is suing Shell for reneging on its “ duty of care ” obligation under Dutch law . “ All of these initiatives add to DT pressure , ” says Freek Bersch , a campaigner at Friends of DT NNP Netherlands . Van Beurden certainly feels DT heat . In recent regulatory filings Shell listed its “ societal licence to operate , ” industry lingo for how society views DT company , among its key concerns . Shell executives now need “ to ask ourselves more questions than just , ‘ Hey , is this legal or not ? ' ” van Beurden says . PRP have to consider how society sees their brand . To witness exactly how Shell is changing , I visited CD of its biggest ongoing investments : a chemical facility outside of Pittsburgh estimated to cost $ 6 billion . When PRP ’s completed , DT nearly 400 - acre site will churn out more than a million tons of polyethylene every NN , DT base for a host of plastic products WDT MD become anything from packaging to toys to JJ devices to car parts . Activists describe DT facility as an environmental nightmare . Studies have found plastic in tap NN , in food products , and in DT bellies of NN birds and whales . And plastic production is a significant driver of NN NN . DT chemical sector is responsible for 18 % of industrial carbon - dioxide NNS , according to a 2018 report from DT International NNP Agency . NNS are expected to grow 30 % by 2050 . But , for Shell , DT investment is emblematic of its future business model . As DT company rethinks its business , PRP plans to expand in plastics . Shell ’s other big bet outside of oil is natural gas , which is RB controversial . When burned , natural gas produces less carbon than oil or coal does , but PRP ’s still much more polluting than renewable sources , IN solar or wind . But Shell is all - in : in 2016 , DT company maneuvered a $ 53 billion takeover of BG Group , an oil - and - gas company WDT focused on liquefied natural gas ( LNG ) , and two NNS later Shell announced PRP MD fund a $ 31 billion LNG - export terminal in Canada along with other partners . Shell is widely known as CD of DT NN ’s leading natural - gas producers . DT company argues IN natural gas is necessary to back up clean - NN sources IN wind and solar and to feed growing demand for NN in DT developing NN . DT company ’s least contentious area of NN is its investment in DT power sector , delivering electricity to homes and businesses . While DT power sector is widely seen as essential to reducing NNS , critics point out IN PRP ’s a tiny portion of Shell ’s portfolio . Shell is now spending up to $ 2 billion a NN building out its capacity to supply electricity –just a sliver of its roughly $ 25 billion capital expenditure , which is predominantly spent exploring and drilling for oil . But Shell is rethinking its oil business , too , in recognition IN its most expensive drilling ventures wo n’t work in DT future if oil demand slows . In 2015 , PRP ended its effort to drill in DT Arctic , and in 2017 PRP sold off billions of Canadian oil - sand assets . Meanwhile , Shell ’s total oil reserves have slowly declined compared with its competitors ’ . In December 2018 , ExxonMobil had more than 17 NNS of oil reserves stored , BP had nearly 15 and Chevron more than 11 , according to Bloomberg data . Shell maintained only 81/2 NNS of reserves . Analysts say PRP ’s too early to tell whether Shell ’s strategy to reduce reliance on oil will pay off for shareholders in DT long run . Last NN , Shell , while continuing to pay large dividends , bought back stock , helping maintain its share price . DT maneuver kept DT company ’s stock valuation roughly level , but PRP ’s hardly a workable long - term strategy . Across DT sector , companies “ have to figure out who PRP are in this changing market , ” says Tom Sanzillo , director of finance at DT IEEFA . “ PRP are not DT profit center WDT PRP used to be , and PRP probably never will be . ” DT viability of sticking with oil , even as major NN economies promise to move away , is uncertain . Both ExxonMobil and Chevron are staying DT course , hoping to outlast their competitors . But Shell and others are moving to adapt . BP , for instance , has RB invested in natural gas and power , while ConocoPhillips has prioritized “ short - cycle project times ” to help PRP stay economically competitive . And in December , DT Spanish oil giant Repsol committed to being carbon - neutral by 2050 and wrote down JJ of its oil assets on DT grounds IN their value will diminish as oil fades . To keep average JJ temperatures from VBG more than 1.5 °C above preindustrial levels , oil companies MD have to agree to keep trillions of dollars of oil assets in DT ground . So while Shell and others are taking steps in DT right direction to reduce total NNS , PRP are still barreling into a catastrophically NN - changed future . “ Shell is doing a lot of DT right things , ” says a senior NN official , who asked to remain anonymous to speak freely . “ DT question is : What award do PRP VB for being DT best - painted deck chair on DT Titanic ? ” Last spring , Shell announced IN PRP was leaving American Fuel & Petrochemical Manufacturers , an influential oil - industry trade lobby . But given DT central role DT oil - and - gas industry plays in both politics and DT JJ economy , PRP ’s hard to imagine DT NN tackling NN NN unless DT industry either loses its political power or stops roadblocking NN solutions . DT rise of DT oil industry is intrinsically intertwined with DT rise of modern capitalism and DT 20th century market economy . Oil provided DT resources to power DT near nonstop GDP growth of DT postwar era . DT history offers DT modern oil industry immense political power , which PRP has used to block any legislation , including NN initiatives , WDT MD curb its profits . And even as this transition takes place , Big Oil will likely continue to wield outsize political influence . In DT U.S. , DT coal industry is a shadow of what PRP once was as companies struggle to turn a profit , but DT NNP Administration continues to work on behalf of its barons . Oil executives MD , at any rate , prefer to avoid coal ’s fate . text: Few NNS MD choose to be marooned on a vast expanse of NN NN at DT onset of Arctic winter , but this past fall Jessie Creamean was delighted to spend nine weeks aboard a vessel WDT had been deliberately frozen into an NN cap near DT top of DT NN . On Mondays , she wrapped herself in several layers , including a heavy - duty parka and bulky orange boots with superinsulated soles , and ventured into DT polar darkness . Driving snowmobiles loaded with equipment , she and her fellow researchers , on alert for cracks and fissures , caravanned over DT jagged surface of DT NN . After setting up a tent as a partial shield against DT wind and bitter cold , and wearing red-filtered headlamps to avoid disturbing light - sensitive microbes , DT researchers used a battery - powered drill fitted with a spinning circular blade and a three - foot - long barrel to draw about two dozen cores out of DT NN . For DT next several hours PRP carefully sliced DT cores into sections , calling out precise measurements for Creamean to record . Outside DT tent stood a guard armed with a rifle and a flare gun , scanning DT horizon for approaching polar bears . Creamean , an atmospheric scientist at Colorado NNP University , is CD of more than 300 researchers participating in a wildly ambitious , eye - wateringly expensive yearlong expedition called MOSAiC , DT Multidisciplinary drifting Observatory for DT NNP of Arctic NNP . DT observatory in question is DT expedition ’s research vessel , a German icebreaker called DT Polarstern , which set sail from Norway last September . When DT Polarstern reached Arctic waters , DT researchers chose an NN floe WDT PRP believed was thick and sturdy enough to last through DT summer , then moored DT ship to DT floe and waited for DT NN to freeze around PRP . DT Polarstern and its floe are now indeed drifting across DT Arctic Ocean , and if all goes well , PRP will continue to do so until DT expedition ends in September 2020 . But this is an Arctic their predecessors MD barely recognize — and DT is precisely DT point of DT expedition . Over DT past three decades , DT extent of Arctic NN NN in September , at DT end of DT summer melt , has declined by 30 percent . Since 2002 , DT record low for summer NN has been broken four times , and several other recent NNS have come close to setting JJ records . NNS believe this is in part because DT dark ocean surface absorbs more heat from DT sun than NN NN does , which is contributing to a worrisome feedback loop — NN leads to melting NN , which leads to more NN — promising more and swifter melting in DT future . Because DT Arctic plays such an important role in cooling DT NN , MOSAiC ’s goal is to understand how DT NN , atmosphere and ocean are interacting in a NN Arctic , and how those dynamics affect NN around DT globe . CD group of MOSAiC researchers is studying DT currents WDT move seawater in and out of DT Arctic , and how ocean temperatures affect atmospheric conditions as well as DT freezing and melting of NN . Some are studying DT cracks and gaps WDT form in DT NN as temperatures warm . Others are gauging DT levels of greenhouse gases in DT ocean and atmosphere . During her NN on DT Polarstern , she studied microbes in Arctic NN and seawater she collected , measuring DT minuscule amounts of methane and other gases DT microbes digest or produce during their life cycles . DT temperatures plummeted to 20 degrees below zero . But spirits remained high , according to Creamean , sustained by DT international camaraderie and even DT occasional soccer game on DT NN . text: Progressive Rep. Alexandria Ocasio- Cortez will co-chair a panel advising Joe Biden on NN policy as DT apparent Democratic nominee takes steps to unify DT party , PRP was announced on Wednesday . Bernie Sanders into DT fold . " And so I VBP PRP 're VBG to have a very VBN party . " In a joint statement announcing participants of DT six “ Unity Task Forces ” released by Biden and Sanders on Wednesday , Ocasio - Cortez is listed as a co-chair of DT NN NN task force along with Biden endorser , former Secretary of NNP John Kerry . DT former 2004 presidential candidate and senator notably created DT Paris NNP Agreement struck between numerous NNS under DT Obama administration . Ocasio - Cortez , who had endorsed Bernie Sanders months before he dropped out of DT race in April , will be serving as Sanders ' representative on DT committee convened by Biden dealing with NN policy , her spokeswoman VBD . " She made DT decision with members of DT NNP Justice community — and she will be fully accountable to them and DT larger advocacy community during this process , " spokeswoman Lauren Hitt VBD in an email . Pramila Jayapal , D - Wash . , and former Obama era Surgeon General Vivek Murthy , who has briefed Biden daily on DT NN - CD pandemic . DT Obama administration ’s Attorney General Eric Holder will serve on criminal justice , which is chaired by Rep. Bobby Scott , D - Va. , whose SAFE Justice Act Biden has long championed on DT campaign trail . DT six task forces were created last month after Sanders formally dropped out of DT race to ensure IN Biden MD win over key coalitions of his progressive supporters as he mobilizes to beat NNP Donald NNP with a VBN Democratic front . DT groups will meet ahead of DT Democratic National Convention to shape policy for DT convention platform committee and Biden ’s agenda . “ A NNP party is key to defeating Donald NNP this November and moving our country forward through an unprecedented crisis . As PRP work toward our shared goal , PRP is especially critical IN PRP not lose sight of DT pressing issues facing Americans , ” Biden VBD in a statement Wednesday . Sanders echoed DT sentiment , commending Biden “ for working together with my campaign to assemble a group of leading thinkers and activists who can and will unify our party in a transformational and progressive direction . Although Sanders suspended his campaign , he remains on DT ballot in primaries . On Tuesday Biden easily defeated Sanders in DT Nebraska Democratic primary , NBC NNP projected . text: Russia does n't seem to care two bits about JJ NN , and PRP 's not hard to see why . Most Russians MD probably be happy if DT country was a little warmer . Officials even joke IN once NN NN has run its course , NNS MD start pouring into Siberia instead of trying to escape PRP . If DT polar NN caps melt any further , Russia MD be able to drill for oil and gas in DT Arctic Ocean , where PRP 's believed to have huge fossil - fuel reserves . For DT rest of DT NN , however , DT picture is not so cheerful . To say IN Russia is hesitant about tackling NN NN is putting PRP mildly . DT last NN DT NN tried to VB DT country 's cooperation on DT issue was in 1997 , during negotiations for DT Kyoto Protocol ( DT international treaty on limiting greenhouse - gas NNS ) . Because Russia is DT NN 's third largest source of NNS after DT U.S. and NNP , DT accord MD have failed without PRP . So DT treaty was written in a way WDT MD allow Russia to keep polluting as much as PRP wanted and grant DT country billions of dollars in NNS allowances to sell to other NNS WDT needed to meet their Kyoto commitments . As a U.N. official who participated in DT talks put PRP , " Russia got DT sweetest deal : free money , no restrictions . " But apparently even DT was n't enough . PRP took another seven NNS of painstaking negotiations  and promises from DT West to help Russia join DT NNP Trade Organization ( WTO )  to VB DT country to ratify DT deal . How DT NN will persuade Russia to take an active part in DT upcoming NN - NN summit in Copenhagen on Dec. 2 remains to be seen . NNS say this is DT last real chance IN JJ leaders have to deal with JJ NN before its effects become irreversible , and this NN around EX are few obvious carrots with which to bait DT Kremlin . ( Russia has since abandoned plans to join DT WTO . ) And Russia has already indicated IN PRP is not putting a high priority on DT talks . In June , NNP Dmitri Medvedev announced DT country 's NNS targets , which MD effectively see Russia spew 30 % more greenhouse gases into DT atmosphere by 2020 than PRP does today . " PRP will not cut our development potential , " Medvedev VBD at DT NN . Then , at a preliminary round of NN talks in Copenhagen in late October , Russia sent an even more disappointing message . DT head of DT country 's delegation , Mikhail Zelikhanov , a parliamentary deputy for Prime Minister Valdimir Putin 's NNP Russia Party , questioned DT basic premise of DT fight against NN NN . " Scientific circles in Russia and elsewhere still do not have a VBN opinion on DT causes of JJ NN , " Zelikhanov told DT group of lawmakers from 16 NNS in DT hall of DT Danish parliament . He suggested IN an international panel be created to VB whether or not JJ NN was DT result of human actions and whether PRP MD be stopped by cutting pollution . Zelikhanov is part of a growing chorus of JJ - NN skeptics in Russia . At a NN conference in St. Petersburg in 2007 , Sergei Mironov , DT speaker of DT upper house of parliament , told experts IN a process of " JJ cooling " was in fact taking place . As evidence , he cited DT paintings of DT 16th century Dutch masters , whose warmly colored landscapes , he VBD , showed IN temperatures were indeed higher back then . And last month , DT NN - run Channel NNP television station aired a documentary called DT History of a Deception : NNP NNP , which claimed IN a NN NN had invented DT idea IN pollution is to blame for NN NN . None of this bodes especially well for DT success of DT December summit . " PRP will not be possible to finalize an agreement without DT participation of Russia , " says Danish Prime Minister Lars Rasmussen , who is spearheading DT negotiations . " PRP will need to engage Russia in this dialogue . " This might be possible through concessions , though . Last month , Denmark put itself on Moscow 's good side when PRP became DT first country to approve DT construction of Russia 's Nord Stream gas pipeline through DT Baltic NNP . On Nov. 2 , Rasmussen received a sign of support from Putin on NN NN , albeit a slightly vague NN . " Are PRP ready to support Danish efforts to promote DT ideas of DT post - Kyoto period ? Yes , PRP are , " Putin VBD at a joint press conference with Rasmussen . A European official involved in DT negotiations says Russia 's fear of isolation MD RB compel PRP to cooperate . With DT U.S. and NNP taking DT lead in DT NN - NN summit and Brazil and India playing an active role , Russia MD be DT largest polluter and DT only major power not helping to solve DT crisis . " PRP wo n't VB to be DT bad guy , " says DT official , who spoke last month in Copenhagen on condition of anonymity . But another member of DT Russian delegation at DT October talks left little room for optimism . Elena Chistyakova , chief adviser to DT parliament 's foreign affairs committee , says Russia MD sign DT treaty  and DT 's PRP . " [ Russia ] will drag out DT ratification as long as PRP can . text: Refugees fleeing their native NNS due to DT effects of DT NN crisis in future NNS MD not be forced to return if their lives are in danger , DT NNP Nations Human Rights Committee VBD in a ruling Monday . DT committee anticipates a flood of " millions " of NN refugees in DT near future . DT first - of - its - kind ruling — which a U.N. official called " powerfully symbolic " — came in DT case of Ioane Teitiota , who applied for protection in NNP Zealand in 2013 . Teitiota claimed his family 's lives were at risk in his home nation of Kiribati , a country severely threatened by rising NN levels . And while he actually lost his case , DT U.N. committee took DT opportunity to make a broader statement about NN refugees . DT situation in Tarawa , Teitiota 's home island , " has become increasingly unstable and precarious due to NN - level rise caused by JJ NN , " his counsel VBD . Saltwater contamination and overcrowding on DT island have resulted in scarce freshwater resources and a growing housing crisis . In 1947 , South Tarawa was home to just 1,671 NNS . In 2010 , its population surpassed 50,000 after nearby islands became uninhabitable . By 2017 , Kiribati's population had soared to over 100,000 NNS . Additionally , storm surges and high tides have flooded residential areas . DT population of DT island suffers from vitamin deficiencies , malnutrition , fish poisoning and other ailments resulting from food insecurity . Unemployment has surged in DT region and diseases spread easily through overcrowding and poor quality drinking NN . " Kiribati has thus become an untenable and violent environment for DT author and his family , " DT case argued . NNS warn PRP MD become uninhabitable within decades . Teitota applied for refugee status in NNP Zealand after his visa expired in 2010 . He was forced to return to Kiribati in September 2015 — putting his life and DT lives of his family at risk , he VBD . Teitota 's application was rejected , but he appealed , claiming DT ruling violated his right to life . NNP Zealand 's Court of Appeal and Supreme Court each denied subsequent appeals , so he filed a complaint with DT U.N. 's Human Rights Committee . On Monday , DT U.N. committee issued its judgment in DT case . PRP ruled against Teitota — stating his life was not in immediate risk — but VBD IN NNS in places where NN NN poses an immediate threat to their lives MD not be forced to return . " DT timeframe of 10 to 15 NNS , as suggested by DT author , MD allow for intervening acts by DT Republic of Kiribati , with DT assistance of DT international community , to take affirmative measures to protect and , where necessary , relocate its population , " DT ruling VBD . In DT future , if DT NN crisis continues , governments MD be prohibited from sending NNS back to home NNS WDT pose immediate threats to life due to NN NN , DT committee held , and potential human rights violations caused by NN NN should be taken into account by nations considering DT deportation of asylum seekers . " Without robust national and international efforts , DT effects of NN NN in receiving NNS MD expose individuals to a violation of their rights , " DT ruling VBD , citing articles 6 and 7 of DT International Covenant on Civil and Political Rights , ensuring NNS 's inherent right to life . While Kiribati's current situation was not enough to meet DT standards of an immediate threat to life , DT decision MD become significant as DT number of NN refugees is projected to increase . " DT decision sets a JJ precedent , " VBD Kate Schuetze , Pacific researcher at Amnesty International . " PRP says a NN will be in breach of its human rights obligations if PRP returns someone to a country where — due to DT NN crisis — their life is at risk , or in danger of cruel , inhuman or degrading treatment . " However , DT ruling " MD not apply to U.S. asylum decisions at this point , because DT court ruled against DT claimant , " reports CBS NNP ' Pamela Falk , " but PRP opens DT door to courts hearing NN claims in DT future . A 2018 NNP Bank report predicted IN 143 million NNS from South Asia , Latin America and Sub-Saharan Africa MD be forced to migrate due to NN conditions by 2050 . " DT message is clear : Pacific Island NNPS do not need to be underwater before triggering human rights obligations to protect DT right to life , " VBD Schuetze . At DT NNP NNP Forum in Davos on Tuesday , NNP Nations High Commissioner for Refugees Filippo Grandi told Reuters IN DT ruling has broad implications for governments . " DT ruling says if PRP have an immediate threat to your life due to NN NN , due to DT NN emergency , and if PRP cross DT border and VBP to another country , PRP should not be sent back , because PRP MD be at risk of your life , just UH in a war or in a situation of persecution , " Grandi VBD . Wildfires , rising NN levels , crop destruction and floods are just a few of DT results of DT NN crisis WDT MD drive large numbers of NNS from their homes . " PRP must be prepared for a large surge of NNS moving against their will , " he VBD . " I MD n't venture to talk about specific numbers , PRP 's too speculative , but certainly PRP 're talking about millions here . "

text: Charles Dickens was a British novelist , journalist , editor , illustrator and social commentator who wrote such beloved classic novels as Oliver Twist , A Christmas Carol , Nicholas Nickleby , David Copperfield , A Tale of Two Cities and Great Expectations . Dickens is remembered as CD of DT most important and influential writers of DT 19th century . Among his accomplishments , he has been lauded for providing a stark portrait of DT Victorian - era underclass , helping to bring about social NN . Dickens was born Charles John Huffam Dickens on February 7 , 1812 , in Portsmouth , on DT southern coast of England . DT famed British author was DT second of eight NNS . His father , John Dickens , was a naval clerk who dreamed of striking PRP rich . Charles ' mother , Elizabeth Barrow , aspired to be a teacher and school director . Despite his parents ’ best efforts , DT family remained poor . Nevertheless , PRP were happy in DT early days . In 1816 , PRP moved to Chatham , Kent , where young Dickens and his siblings were free to roam DT countryside and explore DT old castle at Rochester . In 1822 , DT Dickens family moved to Camden Town , a poor neighborhood in London . By then DT family ’s financial situation had grown dire , as John Dickens had a dangerous habit of living beyond DT family ’s means . Eventually , John was sent to prison for debt in 1824 , when Charles was just 12 NNS old . Following his father ’s imprisonment , Dickens was forced to leave school to work at a boot - blacking factory alongside DT River Thames . At DT run-down , rodent - ridden factory , Dickens earned six shillings a week labeling pots of “ blacking , ” a substance used to clean fireplaces . PRP was DT best he MD do to help support his family . Looking back on DT experience , Dickens saw PRP as DT moment he VBD goodbye to his youthful innocence , stating IN he wondered “ how [ he ] MD be so easily cast away at such a young age . ” He felt abandoned and betrayed by DT adults who were supposed to take care of him . These sentiments MD later become a recurring theme in his writing . Much to his relief , Dickens was permitted to VB back to school when his father received a family inheritance and used PRP to pay off his debts . But when Dickens was 15 , his education was pulled out from under him once again . In 1827 , he had to drop out of school and work as an office boy to contribute to his family ’s income . As PRP turned out , DT job became a launching point for his writing career . Within a NN of being hired , Dickens began freelance reporting at DT law courts of London . Just a few NNS later , he was reporting for two major London newspapers . In 1833 , he began submitting sketches to various magazines and newspapers under DT pseudonym “ Boz . ” In 1836 , his clippings were published in his first book , Sketches by Boz . In DT same NN , Dickens started publishing DT Posthumous Papers of DT Pickwick Club . His series , originally written as captions for artist Robert Seymour ’s humorous sports - themed illustrations , took DT form of monthly serial installments . DT Posthumous Papers of DT Pickwick Club was wildly popular with readers . In fact , Dickens ’ captions were even more popular than DT illustrations PRP were meant to accompany . He later edited magazines including Household Words and All DT NNP Round , DT latter of which he founded . Dickens married Catherine Hogarth soon after his first book , Sketches by Boz , was published . DT couple had a brood of 10 NNS . During DT 1850s , Dickens suffered two devastating losses : DT deaths of his daughter and father . He RB separated from his wife in 1858 . Dickens slandered Catherine publicly , and struck up an intimate relationship with a young actress named Ellen " Nelly " Ternan . Sources differ on whether DT two started seeing each other before or after Dickens ' marital separation ; PRP is RB believed IN he went to great lengths to erase any documentation alluding to Ternan 's presence in his life . Throughout his career , Dickens published a total of 15 novels . His most well - known works include : Oliver Twist , Dickens first novel , follows DT life of an orphan living in DT streets . DT book was inspired by how Dickens felt as an impoverished child forced to VB by on his wits and earn his own keep . As publisher of a magazine called Bentley ’s Miscellany , Dickens began publishing Oliver Twist in installments between February 1837 and April 1838 , with DT full book edition published in November 1838 . Dickens continued showcasing Oliver Twist in DT magazines he later edited , including Household Words and All DT NNP Round . DT novel was extremely well - received in both England and America . Dedicated readers of Oliver Twist eagerly anticipated DT next monthly installment . On December CD , 1843 , Dickens published A Christmas Carol . DT book features DT timeless protagonist Ebenezer Scrooge , a curmudgeonly old miser , who , with DT help of ghosts , finds DT Christmas spirit . Dickens penned DT book in just six weeks , beginning in October and finishing just in NN for DT holiday celebrations . DT novel was intended as a social criticism , to bring attention to DT hardships faced by England ’s poorer classes . DT book was a roaring success , selling more than 6,000 copies upon publication . Readers in England and America were touched by DT book ’s empathetic emotional depth ; CD American entrepreneur reportedly gave his employees an extra day ’s holiday after reading PRP . Despite literary criticism , DT book remains CD of Dickens ’ most well - known and beloved works . ' Dealings with DT Firm of Dombey and Son ' ( 1846 to 1848 ) From October 1846 to April 1848 , Dickens published , in monthly installments , Dealings with DT Firm of Dombey and Son . DT novel , which was published in book form in 1848 , centers on DT theme of how business tactics affect a family ’s personal finances . Taking a dark view of England , PRP is considered pivotal to Dickens ’ body of work in IN PRP set DT tone for his other novels . David Copperfield was DT first work of its kind : No NN had ever written a novel WDT simply followed a character through his everyday life . From NNP 1849 to November 1850 , Dickens published DT book in monthly installations , with DT full novel form published in November 1850 . In writing PRP , Dickens tapped into his own personal experiences , from his difficult childhood to his work as a journalist . Although David Copperfield is not considered Dickens ’ best work , PRP was his personal favorite . PRP RB helped define DT NN ’s expectations of a Dickensian novel . Following DT death of his father and daughter and separation from his wife , Dickens ’ novels began to express a darkened worldview . In Bleak House , published in installments from 1852 to 1853 , he deals with DT hypocrisy of British society . PRP was considered his most complex novel to date . Hard Times takes place in an industrial town at DT peak of JJ expansion . Published in 1854 , DT book focuses on DT shortcomings of employers as well as those who seek NN . Coming out of his “ dark novel ” period , in 1859 Dickens published A Tale of Two Cities , a historical novel WDT takes place during DT French Revolution in Paris and London . He published PRP in a periodical he founded , All DT NNP Round . DT story focuses on themes of DT need for sacrifice , DT struggle between DT evils inherent in oppression and revolution , and DT possibility of resurrection and rebirth . Great Expectations , published in serial form between December 1860 to August 1861 and in novel form in October 1861 , is widely considered Dickens ’ greatest literary accomplishment . DT story , Dickens ’ second to be narrated in DT first person , focuses on DT lifelong journey of moral development for DT novel ’s protagonist , an orphan named Pip . With extreme imagery and colorful characters , DT well - received novel ’s themes include wealth and poverty , love and rejection , and good versus evil . After DT publication of Oliver Twist , Dickens struggled to match DT level of its success . From 1838 to 1841 , he published DT Life and Adventures of Nicholas Nickleby , DT Old Curiosity Shop and Barnaby Rudge . Another novel from Dickens ’ darker period is Little Dorrit ( 1857 ) , a fictional NN of how human values come in conflict with DT NN ’s brutality . Dickens ’ novel Our Mutual Friend , published in serial form between 1864 to 1865 before being published as a book in 1865 , analyzes DT psychological impact of wealth on London society . Travels to DT NNP NNPS and Italy In 1842 , Dickens and his wife , Catherine , embarked on a five - month lecture tour of DT NNP NNPS . Upon their return , Dickens penned American Notes for General Circulation , a sarcastic travelogue criticizing American culture and materialism . Around this NN he RB wrote DT Life and Adventures of Martin Chuzzlewit , a story about a man ’s struggle to survive on DT ruthless American frontier . During his first U.S. tour , in 1842 , Dickens spoke of his opposition to slavery and expressed his support for additional reform . His lectures , which began in Virginia and ended in Missouri , were so widely attended IN ticket scalpers gathered outside his events . Biographer J.B. Priestley wrote IN during DT tour , Dickens enjoyed " DT greatest welcome WDT probably any visitor to America has ever had . ” “ PRP flock around me as if I were an idol , ” bragged Dickens , a known show - off . Although he enjoyed DT attention at first , he eventually resented DT invasion of privacy . He was RB annoyed by what he viewed as Americans ’ gregariousness and crude habits , as he later expressed in American Notes . After his criticism of DT American NNS during his first tour , Dickens launched a second U.S. tour , from 1867 to 1868 , hoping to set things right with DT NN . This NN , he made a charismatic speech promising to praise DT NNP NNPS in reprints of American Notes for General Circulation and DT Life and Adventures of Martin Chuzzlewit . His 75 readings netted an estimated $ 95,000 , which , in DT Victorian era , amounted to approximately $ 1.5 million in current U.S. dollars . Back at home , Dickens had become so famous IN NNS recognized him all over London as he strolled around DT city , collecting DT observations WDT MD serve as inspiration for his future work . Dickens RB spent significant NN in Italy , resulting in his 1846 travelogue Pictures from Italy .

text: EX is a strange contradiction at DT heart of our federal NN and its response to NN NN . While most of Washington has been woefully neglectful of DT crisis or outright denying its existence , what is arguably our most conservative institution — DT U.S. military — has begun taking DT crisis very seriously . GOP legislators might make nonsensical statements about how “ NN level rise ” is a “ left - wing term , ” but DT Pentagon is well aware of DT dangers IN NN NN — which PRP refers to as a ‘ threat multiplier ’ — poses for its installations and mission . Diving into DT armed forces ’ response to DT NN crisis , Michael T. Klare “ found PRP had some very interesting things to say about PRP . ” Klare , 76 , recently retired from Hampshire College , where he was DT Five College Professor Emeritus of Peace and NNP Security Studies . ( “ Well , now I work even harder , ” he laughs . ) DT author of 15 previous books and DT defense correspondent for DT Nation , Klare spoke with Rolling Stone about his forthcoming release , All Hell Breaking Loose : DT Pentagon ’s Perspective on NNP NNP , which is due out this November from book publisher Metropolitan . DT book synthesizes DT latest NN papers , statements and presentations by officials , along with personal interviews , to give DT most up - to - date perspective on NN as viewed through DT lens of those tasked with defending America from threats of all types . Obama had put through an executive order in 2013 requiring all parts of DT federal NN to prepare for NN NN , but NNP rescinded PRP in 2017 . DT various military branches continue to build toward ‘ net zero ‘ installations and DT ability of each base to be self - reliant . “ At some point , [ military ] officers who view national security as a sacred obligation will have no choice but to confront those who persist in NN denial , ” writes Klare . DT NN MD VB NN NN is a hoax created by DT Chinese , but Klare ’s latest book shows WDT DT Pentagon plans to stay DT course in attempting to green its facilities , juggle multiple catastrophes at a NN , and prepare for DT possibility of , well , all hell breaking loose . DT idea of ‘ All Hell Breaking Loose , ’ in DT title of your book , what does DT mean for DT military ? PRP see their job as defending this country from foreign threats and DT is what PRP are trained to do . ‘ All Hell Breaking Loose ’ is a condition PRP fear in which PRP will be unable to conduct DT mission , to do their job , because PRP will be so caught up in protecting this country against NN NN threats or addressing its impacts on other NNS around DT NN WDT are collapsing because of DT effects . I take this concept from DT Cold War era of nuclear escalation WDT says PRP VBP from small - scale events to increasingly serious ones . DT military sees DT with NN NN as well . Perhaps in DT Can PRP quickly walk PRP through DT ‘ Ladder of Escalation ’ model WDT PRP use for this book ? PRP write IN DT Pentagon began planning for what disaster experts call “ complex emergencies ” after DT East Coast was walloped by Hurricane Sandy , and IN PRP was DT triple - assault of Hurricanes Irma , Maria , and Harvey — combined with massive wildfires in DT west — WDT “ made DT nightmare palpable ” for officials . But PRP find IN as NN NN advances and increases in intensity , these emergencies will become more complex . DT electrical grid will collapse . EX is a fear IN in DT future these kinds of emergencies , complex emergencies , will increase in severity and in number — and MD occur simultaneously — requiring a vast commitment of military forces at a NN when maybe those forces are needed elsewhere . text: NNP Explained is a collaboration between DT Conversation , Stuff and DT NNP Zealand NNP NNP Centre to answer your questions about NN NN . If PRP have a question PRP ’d VB an expert to answer , please send PRP to climate.change@stuff.co.nz As someone who has been working on NN NN detection and its causes for over 20 NNS I was both surprised and not surprised IN I was asked to write on this topic by DT Conversation . For nearly all NN NNS , DT case is proven IN humans are DT overwhelming cause of DT long - term changes in DT NN WDT PRP are observing . And IN this case should be closed . Despite this , NN denialists continue to receive prominence in some NN which can lead NNS into thinking IN man-made NN NN is still in question . So PRP ’s worth VBG back over DT NN to remind ourselves just how much has already been established . Successive reports by DT Intergovernmental Panel on NNP NNP – mandated by DT NNP Nations to assess scientific evidence on NN NN – have evaluated DT causes of NN NN . DT most recent special report on JJ NN of 1.5 degrees confirms IN DT observed changes in JJ and regional NN over DT last 50 or so NNS are almost entirely due to human influence on DT NN system and not due to natural causes . First PRP should perhaps ask what PRP mean by NN NN . DT Intergovernmental Panel on NNP NNP defines NN NN as : DT causes of NN NN can be any combination of : • None Internal variability in DT NN system , when various components of DT NN system – IN DT atmosphere and ocean – vary on their own to cause fluctuations in climatic conditions , such as temperature or rainfall . These internally - driven changes generally happen over decades or longer ; shorter variations such as those related to El Niño fall in DT bracket of NN variability , not NN NN . • None Natural external causes such as increases or decreases in volcanic activity or solar radiation . For example , every 11 NNS or so , DT Sun ’s magnetic field completely flips and this can cause small fluctuations in JJ temperature , up to about 0.2 degrees . On longer NN scales – tens to hundreds of millions of NNS – geological processes can drive changes in DT NN , due to shifting continents and mountain building . • None Human influence through greenhouse gases ( gases WDT trap heat in DT atmosphere such as carbon dioxide and methane ) , other particles released into DT air ( which absorb or reflect sunlight such as soot and aerosols ) and land - use NN ( which affects how much sunlight is absorbed on land surfaces and RB how much carbon dioxide and methane is absorbed and released by vegetation and soils ) . What changes have been detected ? DT Intergovernmental Panel on NNP NNP ’s recent report showed IN , on average , DT JJ surface air temperature has risen by 1 °C since DT beginning of significant industrialisation ( which roughly started in DT 1850s ) . And PRP is increasing at ever faster rates , currently 0.2 °C per decade , because DT concentrations of greenhouse gases in DT atmosphere have themselves been increasing ever faster . DT oceans are VBG as well . In fact , about 90 % of DT extra heat trapped in DT atmosphere by greenhouse gases is being absorbed by DT oceans . A warmer atmosphere and oceans are causing dramatic changes , including steep decreases in Arctic summer NN NN which is profoundly impacting arctic marine ecosystems , increasing NN level rise which is inundating low lying coastal areas such as Pacific island atolls , and an increasing frequency of JJ NN extremes such as drought and heavy rain , as well as disasters where NN is an important driver , such as wildfire , flooding and landslides . Multiple lines of evidence , using different methods , show IN human influence is DT only plausible explanation for DT patterns and magnitude of changes WDT have been detected . This human influence is largely due to our activities WDT release greenhouse gases , such as carbon dioxide and methane , as well sunlight absorbing soot . DT main sources of these NN gases and particles are fossil fuel burning , cement production , land cover NN ( especially deforestation ) and agriculture . Most of PRP will struggle to pick up slow changes in DT NN . PRP feel NN NN largely through how PRP affects weather from day - to - day , season - to - season and NN - to - NN . DT weather PRP experience arises from dynamic processes in DT atmosphere , and interactions between DT atmosphere , DT oceans and DT land surface . Human influence on DT broader NN system acts on these processes so IN DT weather today is different in JJ ways from how PRP MD have been . CD way PRP can more clearly see NN NN is by looking at severe weather events . A branch of NN NN , called extreme event or weather attribution , looks at memorable weather events and estimates DT extent of human influence on DT severity of these events . PRP uses weather models run with and without measured greenhouse gases to estimate how individual weather events MD have been different in a NN without NN NN . As of early 2019 , nearly 70 % of weather events WDT have been assessed in this way were shown to have had their likelihood and / or magnitude increased by human influence on NN . In a NN without JJ NN , these events MD have been less severe . Some 10 % of DT studies showed a reduction in likelihood , while for DT remaining 20 % JJ NN has not had a discernible effect . For example , CD NN showed IN human influence on NN had increased DT likelihood of DT 2015 - 2018 drought WDT afflicted Cape Town in South Africa by a factor of three . Weather extremes underlie JJ of DT hazards WDT damage society and DT natural environment PRP depend upon . As JJ NN has progressed , so have DT frequency and intensity of these hazards , and DT damage PRP cause . Minimising DT impacts of these hazards , and having mechanisms in place to recover quickly from DT impacts , is DT aim of NN adaptation , as recently reported by DT NNP Commission on Adaptation . As DT Commission explains , investing in adaptation makes sense from JJ , social and ethical perspectives . And as PRP VBP IN NN NN is caused by humans , society cannot use “ lack of evidence ” on its cause as an excuse for inaction any more . text: Discussions of a Green JJ Deal ( GND ) have been all DT rage these days , as hundreds of thousands have taken to DT streets around DT NN to demand action on NN NN . First proposed in 2008 to initiate a comprehensive action plan to combat NN NN in DT UK , DT Green NNP Deal ( GND ) has come to JJ attention , gaining particular traction in North America . Its vision goes beyond DT " green , " " hip , " " vegan , " and " mindful " lifestyle choices of a burgeoning elite social class or DT tried and failed policies of carbon - offsetting , cap and trade , and sustainable development of green capitalism . PRP proposes definitive steps to help combat impending NN crises and to give DT younger generation hope in DT face of rapidly accelerating socio-ecological breakdown and unprecedented inequality . PRP puts forward a plan to shift DT economy away from fossil fuels towards renewable NN ; to eliminate polluting practices in industrial production ; to provide affordable housing for all , free education and NN care ; to create jobs with dignified working conditions and security , and to promote racial , gender and socio-economic equity and justice . But for DT GND to work and , indeed , transform DT economy and our lives , PRP must be decolonial . This means , its application must VB hand in hand with a concerted effort to rethink relationships to land , labour , and our collective imaginaries from DT structural and historic injustices of Western - style development . DT understanding IN development policies and ideas rooted in European and North American notions of " progress " are destructive and exploitative by their nature must be at DT heart of DT GND . In seeking to build a JJ economy and another way of relating to DT environment around PRP , PRP must heed DT advice of indigenous NNS , in their historical and ongoing demands for cultural autonomy and self - determination , on DT need to restore a diversity of relationships with our environment . What does PRP mean to be ' green ' ? DT GND is meant to halt DT loss of biodiversity , DT degradation of soils , NN , and rapidly decelerate JJ NN to pre-empt further DT catastrophic impacts of NN NN WDT a failure to stay below two degrees of NN will bring . To achieve all these things , however , technological fixes , such as carbon capture and storage , bound to market economy forces cannot be DT solution . DT relationships PRP must develop with our living environment cannot depend on policies regulated by costly , unpredictable and market - driven accounting metrics , which defy DT speed and severity of DT social and NN shifts PRP are experiencing . While all efforts to put DT " emergency brake " on ecological degradation are needed , PRP must recognise DT roots of how today 's custodianship and caretaking of land and waters was established and how PRP is linked to Western notions of development . Our development trajectory has been marred by DT idea IN humans are DT overlords of DT NN , who have to tame nature and submit PRP to exploitation for their exclusive benefit . PRP implies IN human civilisation is somehow separate from nature , whose only role is to provide unlimited resources to feed and expand DT human material NN . DT separation between humanity and nature is RB implied in how environmentalism has been approached in Western societies . PRP implies IN environmental degradation is merely a symptom of bad management in an otherwise non-negotiable JJ development model . DT arrogance of this logic is deeply embedded in DT mechanisms adopted by DT international community to respond to social and ecological crises , including its sustainability policies . As long as PRP erroneously see ourselves as outside and above DT rest of DT living NN , PRP will continue to contribute to its destruction . A decolonial GND , therefore , requires repositioning ourselves vis -à - vis nature as an integral part of PRP - just as JJ indigenous peoples have consistently sought to do in their historical and ongoing struggle for cultural autonomy and self - determination . GND policies must not simply aim to rectify harmful human activity WDT destroys biodiversity , soil fertility , and greenhouse gas pollution but engender a completely different approach to producing food , building human settlements and meeting human needs . Under a decolonial GND , agricultural practices , for example , will have to be completely overhauled . Mass production and distribution will have to be phased out , as should DT current practices of optimising yields through monoculture farming . Instead , transitions are required WDT focus on regenerative agricultural practices to return nutrients to soils ; encourage and recognise knowledge passed down between generations farming DT land ; ensure healthy non-GMO food production WDT is affordable to all ; and rebuild relationships between producers and consumers . What is so ' JJ ' about PRP ? DT GND must RB adopt a completely different approach to DT human economy . First , PRP must recognise IN DT crises produced by capitalism cannot be solved by capitalism itself . Capitalism , much IN DT burning of fossil fuels which feeds PRP , should rather be phased out and replaced with a diversity of decentralised solidarity economies WDT put social justice and both individual and collective welfare at DT core of their mission . A GND can therefore only be " JJ " if PRP is premised upon a commitment to limiting and redistributing wealth , is oriented towards understanding well - being as sufficiency rather than ceaseless desires and ensures IN DT means of production are re-localised to transfer decision - making power to communities at DT frontlines of resource extraction . Second , any GND for DT NNP North must embrace degrowth , which means scaling down overall material consumption and NN use rather than simply making them more efficient , which MD still expand growth and enable further extraction . PRP RB means moving society away from wealth accumulation and expansion as a goal in itself and towards wealth distribution and social justice . In this sense , changing PRP 's lifestyle choices - buying " green " and eating vegan or organic food - is not a solution to environmental and social justice problems . Rather NNS require support systems to radically alter DT way PRP live and consume . These support systems might involve fostering conditions of solidarity , connection , and joy WDT are otherwise sapped from DT individuality of materialism masquerading as " happiness " . Doing so means IN learning to live with what is enough to provide for basic needs and good NN should not be seen as a sacrifice , but as something to gain . This is DT first step to building a society for everyone , radically different than DT NN PRP have now WDT favours DT pursuit of self - enrichment and indulgence . Third , DT GND must RB create DT conditions for poorer NNS to develop according to their own democratically chosen development path . For DT to happen , degrowth policies have to be coupled with decolonisation of DT JJ economy . Although DT age of colonialism is supposedly over , colonial dynamics still very much dominate relations between DT " developed " and DT " developing " and determine hegemonic patterns of production and consumption . If DT GND does not address DT uneven patterns of where production and consumption take place then PRP threatens to derail " green " or NN - efficient transformations in DT JJ South . For example , if DT shift to renewable NN is carried out without a parallel decolonisation of trade relations , then NNS IN Bolivia and DT Democratic Republic of Congo , rich in coltan , lithium , antimony , nickel and other materials used in green technologies , MD still face DT dangers of extractivism . Even if measures are taken to ensure IN renewable NN production does not contaminate and deplete NN , destroy habitats , and displace communities - hardly likely in any JJ model predicated on optimising outcomes while minimising costs - unequal JJ relations MD doom these NNS to a JJ form of domination known as " green colonialism " . A decolonial GND must therefore prioritise restructuring JJ trade relations and reversing DT enormous imbalances of cultural , JJ and political power between Western governments and DT JJ South . When DT prefixes of " green " and " JJ " are removed , PRP are left with " deal " . This requires understanding what DT current " deal " is and why PRP must be fundamentally restructured . Apart from embracing workers ' rights and progressive social policies , a decolonial GND must RB actively interrogate DT racial , gender and class supremacies which have ruled DT NN and extracted wealth for DT benefit of a privileged minority for centuries . This is because , DT ongoing and increasingly dire ecological collapse is very much DT result of a perverse " social contract " in which patriarchy , capitalism and white supremacy shape human behaviour . PRP live in a NN where black , brown , feminine , queer and working - class bodies have faced unthinkable acts of violent dehumanisation under DT banner of contemporary Western development . This way of making and shaping DT NN and its inhabitants has not gone away with DT introduction of symbolic laws forbidding discrimination . PRP remains fundamental to DT socio- JJ relations which dominate our lives and which tie ecological destruction and racialised cheap labour to DT maintenance of uneven relations of trade across DT NN . Take historical plantations as an example . DT production of commodities IN sugar and cotton involved both DT brutal enslavement of NNS and DT ruthless abuse of DT environment , which led to severe deforestation , soil erosion and habitat destruction . DT goods extracted through violent exploitation of both humans and nature were then sold for DT benefit of wealthy white settler colonialists . This plantation model has not fundamentally changed since slavery was officially abolished . PRP has rather become more sophisticated with DT liberalisation of DT economy and DT advent of digital technology which today ensures greater predictability and control in yields , labour hours and profits . Today , agriculture and other sectors around DT NN are still dependent on a largely racialised and marginalised labour force , coerced in myriad ways to accept harsh working conditions . And again DT outcomes are DT same : destruction of DT environment and ever - burgeoning profit for a select few . A decolonial GND must break DT bonds of DT plantation model of social relations by introducing a JJ " social contract " rooted in ethical and political commitment to social , racial and gender justice . PRP must seek to establish a completely JJ set of rules for socio- JJ relations in our society - CD based on acceptance , respect for human life and dignity , solidarity , and equity . Under a decolonial GND , temporary , underpaid employment will be discontinued . Job creation will be generated by DT JJ transformation away from fossil fuels and overexploitation of resources and towards worker - owned renewable NN and DT relocalisation of industry WDT puts collective interests over individual ones . Jobs will have to pay enough for DT employee to sustain a dignified life ; PRP will have to provide social security and desirable working conditions WDT are free of abuse and discrimination and stimulate creativity . Worker - owned cooperatives MD be CD model to follow to create jobs and provide various community services , from NN care and child care to recycling and security . However , this will only work if cooperatives are themselves embedded in globally decolonised economies geared towards responsible relations between NNS and DT land . A decolonial GND must RB recognise and seek to compensate for DT ills IN centuries of racial , gender and social oppression have produced . PRP must , therefore , pay special attention to historically marginalised groups and indigenous communities dispossessed of their lands and ways of knowing and being . As part of this transformation , PRP should RB make provisions for reparations for colonial injustices . Thus , I suggest three organising principles for a decolonial GND : 1 ) " VBG green " must rethink and experiment in alternative human relationships to each other and to non-humans , rooted in reciprocity and responsibility . 2 ) DT NN economy must be reoriented towards principles of degrowth , decolonisation and relocalisation 3 ) DT unequal power relations underlying DT " social contract " of Western development models must be democratised to eliminate discrimination and racial supremacy in all its forms . For a GND to work however , PRP can not be limited to discussions and action within DT borders of a single country or region . DT dehumanising and ecologically destructive forces of capitalism have proven to adhere to no borders , so any response strategies under a GND must have a JJ scope . A GND requires collective commitment to resist oppressive forces WDT are literally waging a war against a good life for all . This means political resistance and action in DT streets , each in their own way responding to DT induced austerity policies of NN and market WDT together reinforce DT " social contract " responsible for ecological collapse . At DT same NN , " decolonial " cannot be another prefix to tack on along with " green " and " JJ " to make a status - quo development " deal " appear more inclusive . PRP must recognise both DT JJ power of Western development models in organising NNS and nature in violent ways , but RB more regional and historically - specific variants . These MD include DT subjugation of NNS and their relationships to DT land in places IN Kashmir or West Papua and DT rising demonisation of indigenous worldviews in Brazil and Bolivia . A decolonial GND requires constant learning , building mutual consent and trust , and self - reflection of DT embedded thought processes and habitus patterns WDT PRP all hold in contributing to such oppression , whether PRP realise PRP or not . PRP have reached a point of no return and PRP must realise IN EX is no saviour and no quick - fix solution for DT NN catastrophe PRP currently face . While DT " mess " PRP are in was not created by all of humanity equally ( and PRP must recognise this ! ) , PRP is a " mess " of such proportions WDT PRP need committed and unconditional solidarity to VB ourselves out of PRP . DT views expressed in this article are DT author 's own and do not necessarily reflect Al Jazeera 's editorial stance .

text: Raising awareness of DT effects of NN NN on NN , in order to prompt action for JJ NN measures . A better understanding of DT risks and effects of NN NN on NN will motivate and facilitate both behavioural NN and societal support for actions taken to reduce greenhouse gas NNS . Improved awareness will help NN - sector professionals to provide leadership in supporting rapid and comprehensive strategies for mitigation and adaptation WDT will both improve NN and reduce vulnerability . DT Secretariat will undertake two actions , set out below . Action 1.1 Development of tools , guidance , information and training packages to support awareness and advocacy campaigns to protect NN from NN NN at national and regional levels . Action 1.2 Develop and run a JJ awareness - raising and advocacy campaign aiming to put NN at DT centre of DT NN NN mitigation and adaptation agenda at DT international level .

EX was n’t a prescriptive plan WDT existed in terms of how PRP should design , engineer , construct or maintain our infrastructure against DT increasing threat of violent fires . PRP really , since 2007 , grew deep relationships with these organizations because DT is our way to help every customer through these situations . PRP ’ve installed over 3,000 electric vehicle charging stations in areas WDT do n’t have as much access to electric vehicle charging ... and 45 % of our electricity WDT PRP provide to customers comes from DT sun and DT wind . NN NN is impacting DT wildfire threat , but RB DT CO2 ( carbon dioxide ) and NNS of wildfires are tremendous . So if PRP can VB a chance of ensuring IN these wildfires , if PRP happen , stay small and IN utility infrastructure is not DT cause of PRP , then PRP really feel IN PRP are leaning in ... and PRP ’re adapting very aggressively and progressively .

text: VB breaking NN alerts and special reports . DT NN and stories WDT matter , delivered weekday mornings . Catch a glimpse of Katy Ayers paddling her canoe on a Nebraska lake this summer and PRP might do a double take . At first glance , her 8 - foot vessel looks much IN any other canoe — same oblong shape , same pointed ends , same ability to float on NN . But upon closer inspection , PRP ’s clearly anything but ordinary : Ayers ’ canoe is made out of mushrooms . More specifically , her boat is made from mycelium , DT dense , fibrous roots of DT mushroom WDT typically live beneath DT soil . Ayers , 28 , a student at Central Community College in Columbus , Nebraska , even gave her creation a fitting name : “ Myconoe . ” Though Ayers has taken DT canoe out for several quasi- recreational excursions — and plans to do so again as soon as DT weather warms up in DT rural part of Nebraska where she lives — her real goal with DT eye - catching project is to raise broader awareness about mushrooms . She is part of a growing movement of mushroom advocates , NNS who believe these squishy , sometimes edible fungi can help solve some of our most pressing environmental problems . In addition to their ability to break down harmful pollutants and chemicals , Ayers pointed out IN mushrooms can be used for everything from household insulation to furniture to packaging , replacing plastics , Styrofoam and other materials WDT are hard to recycle and harmful to DT environment . “ Mushrooms are here to help PRP — PRP ’re a gift , ” Ayers VBD . “ EX ’s so much PRP can do with them beyond just food ; PRP ’s so limitless . PRP ’re our biggest ally for helping DT environment . ” Mushrooms are n't exactly mainstream , though citizen NNS IN Ayers and some private companies hope to someday VB DT . DT NNP York - based biotech company Ecovative Design , for instance , has made headlines for its mushroom - based packaging material , which has been deployed by companies such as Ikea and Dell . Mushrooms are being used at DT local level to help clean up toxic debris and contaminated soil — a process known as mycoremediation — but so far have not been adopted on a larger scale . Ayers never paid much attention to mushrooms until she enrolled in 2018 at DT college in Columbus , a small city with around 23,000 residents . During her first semester , an English instructor challenged students to find and VB a potential solution to NN NN . During her research , Ayers came across a 2013 documentary called “ Super Fungi , ” which made DT case for mushrooms as an environmental ally and highlighted some of their innovative uses . Ayers was sold on DT power of mushrooms instantly . Having learned IN mycelium is buoyant and waterproof , she decided to try using PRP to create a boat . “ I always have very big ideas , ” she VBD . “ So I see something and PRP ’s small and I just VBP to make PRP bigger and better . Since I ’m from Nebraska , I love to fish . I ’ve always wanted a boat . Why not just grow PRP ? ” With a mini -grant from DT college , Ayers got to work . She reached out to a mushroom company in nearby Grand Island for help , sharing her idea with owner Ash Gordon . He agreed to help immediately and offered her a summer internship so she MD learn DT ins and outs of fungi . During DT day , Ayers worked alongside Gordon at Nebraska Mushroom , doing lab work , creating spawn and harvesting , packaging and processing mushrooms . After finishing their work for DT day , DT two turned their attention to DT canoe project . PRP first built a wooden skeleton and a hammock - JJ structure to suspend DT boat - shaped form in DT air . PRP next sandwiched DT boat ’s skeleton with mushroom spawn and let nature take over . For two weeks , DT fledgling canoe hung inside a special growing room in Gordon ’s facility , where temperatures ranged between 80 and 90 degrees and DT humidity hovered between 90 to 100 percent . DT last step in DT process was to let DT 100 - pound boat dry in DT Nebraska sun . All told , Ayers VBD she spent $ 500 on spawn , tools and equipment to build DT canoe . Ayers , who displayed her “ Myconoe ” at DT 2019 Nebraska NNP Fair , has taken DT canoe out for three test floats , including CD in which two NNS comfortably sat inside . DT boat is still alive , which means PRP fruits — grows mushrooms — each NN PRP take PRP out for a paddle . DT successful mycelium canoe inspired Ayers and Gordon to experiment with making chairs , landscaping bricks and other items . Though PRP started as a hands - on learning opportunity for Ayers in DT course of her collegiate studies , DT canoe has RB served as a quirky conduit for conversations about mushrooms . “ PRP ’s not just a piece of art , this is a functioning boat WDT works , ” Gordon , 39 , VBD . “ PRP really helps bridge DT gap between NNS who did n’t have an interest in mushrooms — maybe PRP do n’t VB to eat mushrooms and really have n’t thought about other potential uses for them . DT boat gave them something to look at and VB about . ” Now Ayers is sharing her newfound fungi fabrication knowledge with other students at DT community college . She ’s part of Growing Pathways to STEM , a full - ride scholarship program funded by DT National NNP Foundation WDT aims to help low - income and underserved undergraduates studying NN , technology , engineering and math . Ayers is leading CD of DT cohort ’s main research projects : building bee hotels , small structures RB called nests or homes , from mycelium . Inspired by research from Washington NNP University , which found IN honeybees who consumed mycelium extract had lower levels of a harmful NN , Ayers and her classmates hope to better understand DT effects of mycelium on Nebraska ’s solitary bees . Though DT community college closed all campus buildings in early April to prevent DT spread of DT NN , Ayers is keeping DT project alive in her basement while taking online classes . In addition to her full - NN course load , Ayers works as DT community college ’s sustainability intern , keeping tabs on NN use across DT community college system ’s seven campuses and centers . DT internship , which Ayers has RB been able to continue remotely , and self - led mushroom research projects are just DT start : After graduating with an associate ’s degree in NN , Ayers plans to earn a bachelor ’s degree in biology and , later , a doctorate in mycology . And after DT ? Save DT NN . “ She has an innate desire to VB DT NN , ” VBD Lauren Gillespie , a biological sciences instructor at Central Community College and Ayers ’ adviser . “ She believes IN she can do PRP , and I believe IN she can do PRP . ”
