text: Takeda predicts IN NN NN will help its Zika and dengue fever NNS find a larger market . Roche says PRP MD ultimately make PRP attractive for DT company to develop treatments for diseases IN malaria . And AbbVie says extreme weather events might boost its immunology products . But DT potential risks of NN NN — and DT attendant increase in natural disasters — stand to outstrip any of those incremental gains , as DT companies described in recent risk assessment reports to DT British nonprofit CDP . Hurricanes and superstorms , power outages and flooding all threaten manufacturing facilities and research sites , particularly when animals are involved . Droughts , too , threaten critical NN supplies . Forest fires , even if remote from a given plant or research facility , bring smoke and air pollution WDT can similarly disrupt DT day - to - day work for drug makers and their supply chain . Geography does n’t help , either . DT biotech and pharmaceutical industries — concentrated , as PRP are , in coastal areas IN Boston , NNP Jersey , and California — MD face higher risks for extreme weather events . STAT surveyed DT risk assessment plans for more than a dozen major pharmaceutical companies and spoke with officials at labs WDT survived extreme weather events and others who are planning to avoid their repercussions . All emphasized IN DT risks are already real — and underscored how hard DT industry is working to prepare to meet DT challenge . “ PRP really start to need to ask yourself and sort of reverse - engineer — what are PRP at risk to , what can PRP tolerate as a community , as an asset or a structure , ” VBD William Sweet , an oceanographer with DT National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration , speaking specifically about DT impact of even a small rise in NN level in places prone to flooding . “ Vulnerabilities WDT are exposed by today ’s events , PRP ’s important to document because those likely are VBG to be DT same area WDT VBP exposed and are vulnerable . ” In DT last five NNS alone , extreme weather has caused massive disruptions in DT pharmaceutical and biotech industries . Hurricanes and flooding can wipe out research and manufacturing facilities , smoke and air pollution from forest fires threaten experiments and lab animals — as do frigid temperatures and power outages . And DT gradual rise in average temperatures have some concerned IN plants and animals WDT serve as sources of existing and potential JJ drugs MD vanish . Pfizer , for example , estimates PRP lost $ 195 million in inventory and overhead when three Puerto Rico manufacturing facilities were wiped out by DT recent devastating hurricane season . Eli Lilly ran its Puerto Rico facility with emergency diesel generators “ for months ” after DT storm . For some , Hurricane Maria was a wake - up call . To AstraZeneca , DT storm “ showed DT site was not resilient enough . ” DT company is planning to invest more in weatherproof buildings “ for current and future conditions . ” AbbVie spent a few thousand dollars securing DT roofs on its manufacturing plants on DT island . Wildfires , too , can have an extreme impact — even if PRP occur further afield . For more than a week in November , wildfires in California sent enough small particles into DT air IN PRP became “ unhealthy ” for residents to breathe without filters — and MD have damaged DT air filters WDT research labs do use . “ DT R&D WDT fuels innovative activity in life sciences companies requires conditions WDT are tightly controlled , particularly when PRP comes to air quality , temperature , and other NN settings , ” VBD Will Zasadny , DT California Life Sciences Association ’s communications director . In addition to issues around DT power grid and DT impact DT fires had on employees , he VBD , “ wildfire smoke is damaging on air filtration systems . ” Recent experiences at two research facilities — CD in NNP York and CD in Texas — RB help illustrate DT potential pitfalls for earlier - stage life NN research — as well as DT promise for facilities WDT prepare for extreme weather in advance . When Hurricane Sandy hit NNP York City in 2012 , some of DT facilities at NYU Langone , an academic JJ center with a hospital and research facilities , flooded and lost power — including two of its animal care facilities . As some NNS carried out temperature - sensitive samples in bins filled with dry NN , others delivered NN to DT center ’s aquariums and evacuated DT mice and rats WDT PRP MD . Not all of DT research animals made PRP out . According to a National Academies of NNP report on disaster resilience , 35,000 mice — which represented about $ 25 million and about CD - third of DT system ’s total mouse population — died . “ In a way , DT NN are DT ones who lost , ” VBD Jennifer Pullium , DT director of NYU Langone ’s division of laboratory animal resources . “ DT purpose of these animals is for biomedical research — to improve DT quality of life and NN of NNS . When progress is set back , progress for NNS is set back . ” IN JJ places affected by a disaster , NYU Langone planned to rebuild itself without DT same soft spots . DT meant installing JJ flood barricades and moving critical things IN generators and computers up to higher floors — but RB making non-flood related modifications , IN making sure DT system ’s hospitals had air conditioners hooked up to DT emergency power network . “ Something IN [ Sandy ] really does help crystallize and motivate a lot of action and a lot of thinking WDT MD n’t happen otherwise , ” VBD Paul Schwabacher , NYU Langone ’s senior vice NN of facilities management . “ PRP did allow PRP to make a lot of changes and improve things beyond what PRP ’d been planning at DT NN . ” Langone ’s JJ defenses have n’t been tested yet . But Baylor College of Medicine ’s response to 2017 ’s Hurricane Harvey shows IN good preparation should pay off . DT college lost thousands of research animals in Tropical Storm Allison in 2001 — and spent $ 35 million afterward on better flood defenses , including food gates and pumps . When Hurricane Harvey hit in 2017 — a Category 4 hurricane WDT was CD of DT costliest Atlantic storms ever — DT college was ready . Baylor had a “ ride out ” team of 52 NNS , including some dedicated to taking care of DT JJ school ’s 100,000 animals while DT campus was flooded . None died . Most of DT major biotech and pharmaceutical companies have been preparing for NN NN for NNS . Johnson & Johnson and Novo Nordisk scored an A rating from CDP ; Sanofi , Pfizer , Roche , Novartis , Merck , Eli Lilly , Takeda , and Biogen all scored an A minus . GlaxoSmithKline and AbbVie earned B ratings , and Amgen and Bristol - Myers Squibb got C’s . DT ratings are based on DT company ’s awareness and management of NN NN issues . DT size and type of their investments in those preparations vary . Johnson & Johnson , for example , wrote in its report IN PRP underwent a full - blown review of its NN scarcity activities after a drought affected its facilities in Cape Town , South Africa . Biogen poured $ 500,000 into JJ software to monitor its supply chain after hurricanes and storms affected two of its major locations . Amgen highlighted its efforts to reduce NN use , spotlighting a facility WDT now reuses about 74 percent of DT treated wastewater PRP generates to cool its manufacturing equipment . In Cambridge , Mass . ’s legendary Kendall Square , CD local real estate developer has already worked to ensure IN a third of DT facilities PRP manages RB are prepared for extreme weather events all DT way up through 2050 or further . Those preparations are necessary in part because of where Kendall Square sits . A short walk from DT Charles River , DT biotech hub already faces a small flood risk from major storms . According to a recent city report , JJ issues MD start to crop up soon . By 2050 , DT NN around Boston should be a foot or two higher than PRP was in 2000 — so high IN DT city ’s report on NN NN vulnerability says DT dams WDT separate DT rivers around DT city from Massachusetts Bay MD be pretty useless . If a once - in - a - decade storm hits , winds might blow DT NN up from DT pond or river — a storm surge — or NN might come back up from drainage pipes . Alexandria Real Estate has over 4.3 million square feet of office space in Kendall Square . DT includes at least 1.9 million square feet of brand - JJ space built with NN NN in mind . Gone are basement electrical rooms and data centers — PRP ’ve been moved up to DT first floor . Thresholds for first - floor doors , too , are all above DT point DT city ’s reports suggest NN might ultimately rise if a major storm hits after DT NN levels around DT city have risen by a foot or two . Yet DT real estate company ’s not - inconsiderable power mostly stops at DT thresholds of their own buildings . DT company ca n’t stop a street from flooding or make sure DT city ’s drains wo n’t become overwhelmed with stormwater . Developers in Kendall have tried ; among other things , Alexandria and others have paid for a JJ stormwater drain WDT can take up to 630,000 gallons of stormwater . CD thing WDT Alexandria and others can do — and have done — is ensure IN their buildings wo n’t make flooding worse . Some Alexandria - owned buildings have equipment on DT roofs WDT can store stormwater for a while before its released — slowly — to DT street ; each site RB has a system in place to encourage rain to drain into DT ground first , not into DT streets . And specialized valves prevent sewer backups from bringing DT NN into a building . ( Even DT toilets will still work without adding to DT sewer ’s problems , at least for a day . ) “ PRP ’re confident IN our tenants and our properties here in Kendall Square are well - protected from NN NN vulnerabilities IN flooding , ” Andrews VBD . EX are less tangible risks to consider , too : DT prospect IN if a company ’s approach to NN NN is too timid , PRP MD be harder to recruit talented employees in an industry where sterling job applicants often have DT upper hand . “ As a NN - based company focused on improving DT quality of life , stakeholders MD set expectations related to Biogen ’s efforts towards NN NN , ” DT company stated — adding IN if PRP fail to meet those expectations , potential employees MD VB elsewhere . “ Loss of highly - qualified employees to competitors due to falling short of expectations MD place Biogen ’s research and development efforts at risk . ” Merck ’s report puts a more positive spin on DT issue . “ PRP recognize IN our policies and actions around social and environmental issues such as our carbon footprint can help attract and attain talent , ” DT company wrote . Yet to some , CD industry alone ca n’t make up for a broader failure to act . “ PRP MD seem IN , PRP VBP , as a nation , PRP should be doing much more to try to mitigate these risks . PRP ’re just tremendous , and I do n’t VB PRP ’ve reflected on DT cost of NN NN and other risks WDT are coming , ” VBD NYU ’s Schwabacher . “ PRP MD be doing more — should be doing more . ”

text: FILE - In this March 26 , 2014 file photo , BlackRock Chairman and CEO Laurence Fink is interviewed by Maria Bartiromo on Fox Business Network 's " Opening Bell with Maria Bartiromo , " in NNP York . BlackRock , DT NN 's largest asset manager , is making NN NN central to its investment decisions VBG forward . BlackRock , DT NN 's largest asset manager , is making NN NN central to its investment decisions VBG forward . Fink , who oversees DT management of about $ 7 trillion in funds , VBD in his influential annual letter to CEOs Tuesday , Jan. 14 , 2020 , IN he believes PRP are “ on DT edge of a fundamental reshaping of finance ” because of a NN NN . ( AP Photo / Mark Lennihan , File ) NNP YORK ( AP ) — A changing NN means dramatic risks for DT NN — and for investments too , DT chief of DT NN ’s largest investment manager VBD Tuesday . To prepare for and protect against those risks , BlackRock CEO Laurence Fink VBD in his influential annual letter to CEOs IN his firm , which manages roughly $ 7 trillion for investors , will make a series of moves putting NN NN and sustainability at DT center of its investing approach . Among them , BlackRock will cut out investments in some coal producers from some of its portfolios , sharply increase DT number of sustainability - focused funds WDT PRP offers , and vote against companies at shareholder meetings when PRP ’re too slow in disclosing and mitigating their impact on DT environment . “ NN NN has become a defining factor in companies ’ long - term prospects , ” Fink wrote in his letter , adding IN he believes “ PRP are on DT edge of a fundamental reshaping of finance ” because of PRP . Fink predicted IN DT changes in how capital is deployed will come “ more quickly than PRP see changes to DT NN itself , ” and “ sooner than most anticipate . ” In fact , DT shift is already underway . Investors poured a net $ 20.6 billion into sustainable funds across DT industry last NN , nearly quadruple DT record set a NN earlier , according to Morningstar . Investors , particularly younger ones , increasingly say PRP VBP their money invested with an eye toward sustainability . DT total dollars are still small relative to DT entire industry — investors plugged a total of $ 413.9 billion into all taxable bond funds last NN , while yanking $ 41.3 billion out of all U.S. stock funds — but DT trend is clear and accelerating . Fearful of losing out on those dollars — and DT fees WDT PRP produce — investment companies are rushing to meet DT surging demand . BlackRock and other huge asset managers are generally behind smaller competitors when PRP comes to sustainability , VBD Danielle Fugere , NN of shareholder - advocacy group As PRP Sow . BlackRock , NNP Street , Vanguard and others have been criticized for not doing more about DT environment . Besides protests outside its Manhattan headquarters , BlackRock has RB heard criticism from members of Congress who believe PRP MD better address NN NN . Because of its size and reach , any shift in focus by BlackRock MD alter DT industry . PRP is a major shareholder in thousands of companies through its popular exchange - traded funds WDT track various indexes , as well as its funds run by stock - picking managers . But Fugere VBD Tuesday ’s announcement is only a first step . “ DT words are significant , and DT words show leadership , ” Fugere VBD . “ But DT ’s not enough . PRP have to see on DT ground action , and PRP need to see PRP quickly . EX is no NN . Australia is burning up . California is burning up . ” DT wildfires in parts of Australia and California and other recent disasters have shown big institutional investors IN NN NN is just as much a threat to their returns in DT near term as over DT coming decades . “ DT physical risks have become so immediately clear and stark , ” VBD Amy Borrus , deputy director of DT Council for Institutional Investors , whose members include pension funds , endowments and other U.S. - based asset owners investing more than $ 4 trillion . “ JJ institutional investors will welcome these steps by BlackRock , ” she VBD . “ More and more JJ funds are coming around to DT view IN sound environmental , social and governance practices are not just about making DT NN better but about fundamentally creating and preserving shareholder value . ” This approach to investing comes after a yearslong evolution for DT industry , which began with simple funds WDT bluntly excluded stocks deemed as harmful , such as gun makers or tobacco stocks . Now , fund managers say PRP PRP look at environmental , social and governance issues broadly as part of their analysis of any investment . PRP ’s known as “ ESG ” investing , and proponents say PRP aids investors ’ returns , not just their consciences , because PRP helps them avoid risky stocks and big potential losses . Companies with poor records on environmental issues are more likely to face big fines , for example . For all DT noise made by Fink ’s announcement , DT reaction in DT stock market was muted on Tuesday . NN stocks in DT S&P 500 were down , but not as much as some other corners of DT market . Coal stocks were mixed . In his letter , Fink VBD companies and investors have a role to play in DT transition to a low - carbon NN , but governments will ultimately need to lead DT way . Some movement has begun . DT European Union on Tuesday unveiled a plan to dedicate a quarter of its budget to tackling NN NN and to help shift 1 trillion euros ( $ 1.1 trillion ) in investment towards making DT economy more environmentally friendly over DT next 10 NNS . DT Europe Investment Plan will be funded by DT EU budget and DT private sector . text: As I report on NN NN , I come across a lot of scary facts , IN DT possibility IN thawing permafrost in Siberia MD release gigatons of carbon dioxide into DT atmosphere or DT risk IN Greenland MD pass a tipping point and begin to melt rapidly . But CD of DT most frightening studies I 've read recently had nothing to do with icebergs or mega - droughts . In a paper WDT came out Oct. 23 in NNP , John Sterman  a professor at Massachusetts Institute of Technology 's ( MIT ) Sloan School of Management  wrote about asking 212 MIT grad students to give a rough idea of how much governments need to reduce JJ greenhouse gas NNS by to eventually stop DT increase in DT concentration of carbon in DT atmosphere . When DT MIT kids can't figure out NN NN , what are DT odds WDT DT broader NN will ? DT shocking NN reflects DT tremendous gap WDT exists regarding JJ NN . On DT CD hand are DT NNS , who with few exceptions VBP NN NN is very serious and needs to be dealt with immediately and ambitiously . On DT other side is DT NN , which increasingly believes IN NN NN is real and worries about PRP , but which rarely ranks PRP as a high priority . A 2007 survey by DT U.N. Development Programme found IN 54 % of Americans advocate taking a " wait and see " approach to NN - NN action  holding off on DT deep and rapid cuts in JJ NN WDT MD immediately impact their lives . ( And PRP 's not just SUV - driving Americans who take this position  similar majorities were found in Russia , NNP and India . ) As a result , PRP have our current dilemma : a steady drumbeat of scientific evidence of JJ NN 's severity and comparatively little in DT way of meaningful political action . " This gap exists , " says Sterman . " DT real question is why . " Hear Bryan Walsh and John Sterman talk about DT problems faced by NNS in communicating DT risks of NN NN . DT 's where Sterman 's research comes in . " EX is a profound and fundamental misconception about NN , " he says . DT problem is IN most of PRP do n't really understand how carbon accumulates in DT atmosphere . Increasing JJ temperatures are driven by DT increase in DT concentration of carbon in DT atmosphere . After a few centuries of burning coal , oil and other fossil fuels , PRP 've raised DT concentration to 387 p.p.m. , and PRP continues to rise by about 2 p.p.m. every NN . JJ NNS believe IN PRP need to at least stabilize carbon concentrations at 450 p.p.m. to ensure IN JJ temperatures do n't increase more than about 2 degrees Celsius above DT pre-industrial level . To do DT , PRP need to reduce JJ carbon NNS ( which hit about 10 billion tons last NN ) until PRP are equal to or less than DT amount of carbon sequestered by DT oceans and plant life ( which removed about 4.8 billion tons of carbon last NN ) . PRP 's just IN NN in a bathtub  unless more NN is draining out than flowing in from DT tap , eventually DT bathtub will overflow . DT means IN carbon NNS MD need to be cut drastically from current levels . Yet almost all of DT subjects in Sterman 's NN failed to realize IN , assuming instead IN PRP MD stabilize carbon concentration simply by capping carbon NNS at their current level . DT 's not DT case  and in fact , pursuing such a plan for DT future MD virtually guarantee IN JJ NN MD spin out of control . PRP MD seem to JJ IN good common sense to wait until PRP see proof of DT serious damage JJ NN is doing before PRP take action . But PRP 's not  PRP can't " wait and see " on JJ NN because DT NN has a momentum all its own , and if PRP wait for decades to finally act to reduce carbon NNS , PRP MD well be too late . Most models assume IN PRP is not very sensitive – DT ’s where DT lower 3C comes from – but a whole JJ set of models to be published in 2021 finds much greater sensitivity . PRP put heating at around 5C by DT end of DT century , meaning NNS MD be experiencing as much as 10C of heating over land . Such uncertainty is n’t ideal , but for our purposes let ’s plump for an entirely feasible planetary heating of 4C by DT end of DT century . If DT seems a long NN away , consider IN plenty of NNS PRP VBP will be around then . My NNS will be in their 80s , perhaps with middle - aged NNS and grandchildren . PRP are making their NN and PRP will be a very different place . Four degrees MD not sound IN much – after all , PRP is less than a typical temperature NN between night and day . PRP might even sound pleasant , IN retiring from DT UK to southern Spain . However , an average heating of DT entire globe by 4C MD render DT NN unrecognisable from anything humans have ever experienced . DT last NN DT NN was this hot was 15 m NNS ago during DT miocene , when intense volcanic eruptions in western North America emitted vast quantities of CO . NN levels rose some 40 metres higher than today and lush forests grew in Antarctica and DT Arctic . However , IN JJ heating took place over JJ thousands of NNS . Even at its most rapid , DT rise in CO NNS occurred at a rate 1,000 times slower than ours has since DT start of DT Industrial Revolution . DT gave animals and plants NN to adapt to JJ conditions and , crucially , ecosystems had not been degraded by humans . Things look considerably bleaker for our 2100 NN . Over DT past decade , NNS have been able to produce a far more nuanced picture of how temperature rise affects DT complexities of cloud cover and atmospheric and oceanic circulation patterns and ecology . PRP ’re looking at vast dead zones in DT oceans as nutrients from fertiliser runoff combine with warmer waters to produce an explosion in algae WDT starve marine life of oxygen . This will be exacerbated by DT acidity from dissolved CO , which will cause a mass die - off , particularly of shellfish , plankton and coral . “ PRP will have lost all DT reefs decades before 2100 – at somewhere between 2C and 4C , ” says Johan Rockström , director of DT Potsdam Institute for NNP Impact Research in Germany . NN levels will be perhaps two metres higher and , more worryingly , PRP will be well on our way to an NN - free NN , having passed DT tipping points for DT Greenland and west Antarctic NN sheets , committing PRP to at least 10 metres of NN - level rise in coming centuries . DT ’s because as NN sheets melt , their surface drops to a lower altitude where PRP is warmer , speeding up melting in a runaway feedback loop . Eventually , dark , heat - absorbing land is exposed , speeding DT melting process even more . By 2100 , PRP will RB have lost most low - latitude glaciers , including two - thirds of DT so called third pole of DT Hindu Kush - Karakoram - Himalayan mountains and Tibetan plateau WDT feeds JJ of Asia ’s important rivers . However , most rivers , especially in Asia , will flood more often , according to research by Richard Betts , head of NN impacts at DT Met Office Hadley Centre , because DT hotter atmosphere will produce more intense monsoons , violent storms and extreme rainfall . His studies predict a wide equatorial belt of high humidity WDT will cause intolerable heat stress across most of tropical Asia , Africa , Australia and DT Americas , rendering them uninhabitable for much of DT NN . Tropical forests of heat - tolerant species MD well thrive in this wet zone with DT high CO concentrations , especially with DT disappearance of human infrastructure and agriculture , although DT conditions will probably favour lianas ( vines ) over slower - growing trees , Betts says . To DT south and north of this humid zone , bands of expansive desert will RB rule out agriculture and human habitation . Some models predict IN desert conditions will stretch from DT Sahara right up through south and central Europe , drying rivers including DT Danube and DT Rhine . In South America , DT picture is more complicated : increased precipitation MD enhance DT Amazon rainforest , leading to mightier river flow . Other models predict a weakening of DT easterlies over DT Atlantic , drying DT Amazon , increasing fires and turning PRP from forest to grassland . DT tipping point for DT Amazon MD well be triggered by deforestation ; while DT intact forest MD cope with some drought because PRP generates and maintains its own moist ecosystem , areas WDT have been opened up through degradation allow moisture to escape . “ A combination of NN NN and deforestation MD push PRP into a savannah NN , ” Rockström says . All of nature will be affected by DT NN in NN , ecosystems and hydrology and EX will be plenty of extinctions as species struggle to migrate and adapt to an utterly changed NN . Daniel Rothman , co-director of MIT ’s Lorenz Center , calculates IN 2100 will herald DT beginning of NNP ’s sixth mass extinction event . But what about PRP ? This is undoubtedly a more hostile , dangerous NN for humanity , which by 2100 will number around 11 billion , all of whom will need food , NN , power and somewhere to live . PRP will be , in a giant understatement , problematic . DT good NN is IN humans wo n’t become extinct – DT species can survive with just a few hundred individuals ; DT bad NN is , PRP risk great loss of life and perhaps DT end of our civilisations . JJ of DT places where NNS live and grow food will no longer be suitable for either . Higher NN levels will make today ’s low - lying islands and JJ coastal regions , where nearly half DT JJ population live , uninhabitable , generating an estimated 2 billion refugees by 2100 . Bangladesh alone will lose CD - third of its land area , including its main breadbasket . From 2030 , more than half DT population will live in DT tropics , an area WDT makes up a third of DT NN and already struggles with NN impacts . Yet by 2100 , most of DT low and mid latitudes will be uninhabitable because of heat stress or drought ; despite stronger precipitation , DT hotter soils will lead to faster evaporation and most populations will struggle for fresh NN . PRP will have to live on a smaller land surface with a larger population . Indeed , DT consequences of a 4C warmer NN are so terrifying IN most NNS MD rather not contemplate them , let alone work out a survival strategy . Rockström does n’t VB our chances . “ PRP ’s difficult to see how PRP MD accommodate eight billion NNS or maybe even half of DT , ” he says . “ EX will be a rich minority of NNS who survive with modern lifestyles , no doubt , but PRP will be a turbulent , conflict - ridden NN . ” He points out IN PRP already use nearly half DT NN ’s NN - free surface to produce food for 7 billion NNS and thinks meeting DT needs of 11 billion in such hostile conditions MD be impossible . “ DT reason is primarily making enough food , but RB PRP MD have lost DT biodiversity PRP ’re dependent on and be facing a cocktail of negative shocks all DT NN , from fires to droughts . ” Others are more sanguine . “ I do n’t VB IN humans as a species or even industrial civilisation is seriously threatened , ” says Ken Caldeira , climatologist at DT Carnegie Institution for NNP in California . “ NNS live in Houston , Miami and Atlanta because PRP live in air conditioning through DT hot summers . If NNS are rich enough to air - condition their lives , PRP can watch whatever is DT successor to Game of Thrones on TV , as DT natural NN decays around them , ” he says . But he points out IN while richer NNS risk a loss to their quality of life , DT poorer risk their actual lives . So how might PRP give all of humanity DT best chance ? Our best hope lies in cooperating as never before to radically reorganise our NN : decoupling DT political map from geography . However unrealistic PRP sounds , PRP ’d need to look at DT NN afresh and see PRP in terms of where DT resources are and then plan DT population , food and NN production around DT . PRP MD mean abandoning huge tracts of DT globe and moving NNP ’s human population to DT high latitudes : Canada , Siberia , Scandinavia , parts of Greenland , Patagonia , Tasmania , NNP Zealand and perhaps newly NN - free parts of DT western Antarctic coast . If PRP allow 20 sq m of space per person – more than double DT minimum habitable space allowed per person under English planning regulations – 11 billion NNS MD need 220,000 sq km of land to live on . DT area of Canada alone is 9.9 m sq km and , combined with all DT other high - latitude areas , such as Alaska , Britain , Russia and Scandinavia , EX should be plenty of room for everyone . These precious lands , with tolerable temperatures and access to NN , MD RB be valuable food - growing areas , as well as DT last oases for JJ species , so NNS MD need to be housed in compact , efficient high - rise cities with reflective roofs and resource - recycling systems . DT risks raising local temperatures to intolerable levels , because compact cities function as heat islands , so solar - powered cooling or even artificial winds MD be needed to counteract this . EX is RB an increased risk of epidemics in such densely populated spaces . Peter Cox , a climatologist at DT University of Exeter , thinks this is viable , but MD require a massive programme of infrastructure to manage waste , air quality and NN needs . City - scale underground reservoirs MD supply domestic needs and efficient recycling MD keep NN – and other resources – circulating in DT population for NNS rather than hours . Post - fossil fuels , PRP will require unprecedented electricity production . This MD come from vast arrays of solar - and wind - power plants in a belt across DT uninhabitable desert regions . High - voltage direct current transmission lines MD relay this power to DT cities or PRP MD be stored as thermal NN in molten salts and transported in hydrogen – after solar NN is used to split NN to provide hydrogen for fuel cells . Hydrogen production will be on an industrial scale and PRP MD be used for nonelectric transport , for instance . In DT meantime , DT effective capture from DT air of today ’s carbon NNS will with luck be a reality ; PRP can be stored or used in DT manufacture of materials . Food production will need to be more intensive , efficient and industrial . This will be a mostly vegetarian NN , largely devoid of fish and without DT grazing area or resources for livestock . Poultry MD be viable on DT edges of farmland and synthetic meats and other foods will meet some of DT demand . Heat - tolerant , drought - resistant crop varieties , such as cassava and millet , will replace JJ of our current unmodified staples such as rice and wheat and PRP will grow faster and with greater NN efficiency because of DT high CO levels . CD problem is IN almost all of our agriculture will need to be at higher latitudes , because DT tropics will be too dry or too hot for farmworkers . And DT means less land and less sunlight in winter . “ JJ agriculture MD be limited by DT geometry of NNP ’s orbit around DT sun , ” Cox says . “ However , studies have shown IN crops thrive with artificial light delivered by LEDs at exactly DT right frequencies for photosynthesis . This means PRP MD grow crops through DT winter months , hydroponically in smaller spaces , stacked up in warehouses or even underground , leaving valuable land surfaces for other uses . ” Cultivation of algal mats and crops grown on floating platforms and in marshland MD RB contribute , while crops MD potentially be grown in uninhabitable regions , farmed and processed remotely by artificial farmers . Either way , PRP MD need to use far more precise nutrient and irrigation systems to avoid polluting more fertile ecosystems and reduce food loss and waste . A 4C warmer NN MD well be survivable , but PRP MD be eminently poorer than DT NN PRP currently enjoy . Rockström believes PRP takes PRP beyond our adaptation capabilities . Delivering our NNS to such a deadly home is a horrifying proposition . Given what ’s at stake , PRP MD be worth deploying geoengineering tools , which reflect DT sun ’s heat away from NNP , and so keep JJ heating to safe levels . This MD n’t address DT problem of dissolved carbon killing oceanic life , but PRP MD buy PRP more NN to decarbonise and achieve negative NNS . Crucially , keeping NNP cooler for longer MD help DT poorest NNS to adapt . “ PRP have come to a point where different forms of geoengineering cannot be excluded , ” admits Rockström , “ but SRM [ solar radiation management ] is a very dangerous geopolitical tool to deploy : who decides which part of DT globe to shade ? How MD PRP govern PRP ? ” he asks . Once PRP reach 4C , most models agree PRP will be impossible to return to today ’s abundant NN . “ For me , DT issue is IN PRP are transforming ( and simplifying ! ) our NN for JJ thousands of NNS into DT future with millennia of rising NN [ levels ] , acidified oceans and intolerable tropical temperatures , just because PRP were n’t willing to pay DT small differential between fossil - fuelled prosperity and prosperity fuelled by non-greenhouse - gas - emitting NN systems , ” says Caldeira . PRP are now making DT NN of 2100 and however hard PRP seems to meet our NNS targets , PRP ’ll be far harder for our NNS if PRP do n’t . text: A warmer NN means more and greater extremes in destructive and dangerous weather , such as heat waves , wildfires , droughts , flooding , and violent storms . EX were 70 tropical cyclones or hurricanes in DT Northern Hemisphere in 2018 , compared with DT long - term average of 53 . Powerful and often record - breaking storms brought devastation to DT Mariana Islands , Philippines , Vietnam , Korea , and Tonga . In DT U.S. , hurricanes Florence and Michael caused huge JJ damage and considerable loss of life , DT WMO noted in its annual NN statement . Heat waves resulted in an astounding loss in productivity in 2018 , because PRP was often either too hot to work or even VB outside safely . An incredible 153 billion hours of labour were wiped out last NN due to heat waves , nearly three times more than 2000 , according to DT 2018 report of DT Lancet Countdown on NN and NN NN released November 28 . DT most recent El Niño event ended in 2016 , and PRP was associated with catastrophic coral bleaching on DT Great Barrier Reef , severe droughts in Africa , South America and parts of DT Pacific and southeast Asia , and wildfires in Indonesia and Canada . While DT current El Niño is not expected to be as severe , PRP MD still bring dangerous weather to vulnerable areas around DT NN , NNS warn . El Niño and its opposite , La Niña , form a natural cycle WDT can last from a few months to two or three NNS . When PRP occur , weather patterns around DT NN can be affected , producing a range of impacts on crop yields , famine , heating , and cooling demands of homes and buildings , fire risks , coral bleaching , and extreme weather . Researchers say DT impacts of El Niño / La Niña events have become more severe over DT past 20 NNS due to a warmer NN . This is akin to an athlete on steroids who takes stimulants during DT Olympic final . DT combination of human - caused NN and a natural upswing in temperatures increases DT odds IN any JJ El Niño NN will be DT warmest ever , VBD NN scientist Michael Mann from Pennsylvania NNP University . Mann co-authored a 2018 NN linking NN NN to DT recent run of record - breaking droughts , heat waves , wildfires , and flooding events in DT northern hemisphere . These destructive weather extremes will increase 50 percent on average and MD increase as much as 300 percent due to NN NN alone unless DT NN acts quickly to cut carbon NNS from burning fossil fuels , DT NN concluded . Normally , El Niño events bring heavy rains to California , and if DT happens this winter PRP MD lead to flash flooding and mud slides after wildfires burned 1.6 million acres this autumn , VBD Stevenson . Nearly 14,000 homes were destroyed in those fires and now DT first storms of DT season have already produced flooding and mud slides . While El Niño brings rain and cooler weather to DT southern U.S. , PRP brings heat and drought to Australia , as well as dry winter conditions in southeastern Africa and northern Brazil . Catastrophic wildfires have already broken out in eastern Australia , along with a heat wave with temperatures over 44 degrees C ( 111 degrees F ) at DT end of November . As JJ NN continues future El Niño events will likely result in even cooler and wetter conditions in DT U.S. , enhancing flood risks . Meanwhile , La Niña events will increase wildfire danger and drought in DT southwestern NNP NNPS , Stevenson VBD . While DT impacts of El Niño / La Niña events are amplified in a warmer NN , PRP ’s not known whether NN NN will affect DT occurrence or strength of these events in DT future , she VBD . La Niña and El Niño are , respectively , DT cold and warm phases of DT El Niño - Southern Oscillation ( ENSO ) cycle , which regulates heat in DT eastern tropical Pacific Ocean . In conditions defined by climatologists as " neutral , " high air pressure predominates in DT eastern Pacific , while low pressure predominates in DT west . DT difference in pressure generates DT trade winds , which blow east to west over DT surface of DT tropical Pacific , pushing DT warm waters westward . DT deeper , cooler waters then surface in DT east , replacing DT warm waters .

text: This is historical material , " frozen in NN . " DT web site is no longer updated and links to external web sites and some internal pages will not work . Members : DT NN task force is a task force of DT whole council , which includes members from business , NN , environmental and civic organizations . NN NN Task Force Member List History : DT task force decided to focus on four areas of policy development : • NN NN Principles . These principles provide DT Council with a shared statement on NN NN and guide DT Council 's more in - depth discussions of NN NN policies and approaches . View Principles . • Technology Working Group . This group examined DT various types of technologies WDT are currently available , under development , or anticipated WDT MD help reduce greenhouse gas NNS , as well as examined various policies or incentives WDT MD foster DT development and dissemination of these technologies in this country and abroad . Working Group Tri-chairs : General Motors , NNP Resources Institute and DT U.S. Department of NNP • Working Group on JJ , Regulatory , and Voluntary Measures . This group examined a broad range of JJ instruments , regulatory approaches , and voluntary steps WDT MD be taken to reduce NNS of greenhouse gases . These MD include tradeable permits ; tax credits / deductions for investing in improved technologies ; carbon taxes ; mitigation measures for JJ or regional dislocations ; partnerships among DT investment and insurance communities , NN , and industry ; various regulatory approaches ; and voluntary initiatives . • Working Group on Cross- cutting Policies . Policies were identified to reduce NNS of greenhouse gases while RB furthering progress in other areas of sustainable development . This working group provided a focus for drawing linkages between DT NNP NNP Task Force and DT Council 's other task forces ( Environmental Management , Metropolitan / Rural Strategies for Sustainable Communities , and International ) and for identifying those policies WDT MD have benefits in more than CD area . Other areas of activity include : • Demonstrating DT Implementation of Greenhouse Gas Reduction Policies and Activities • JJ outreach activities including community forums , DT creation of a website , providing information to DT NN , and giving speeches and presentations on NN NN policies and activities . • Working with DT Council 's Evaluating Progress Working Group to identify indicators and measures for tracking progress in addressing DT issue of NN NN . Progress Report : DT NNP task force sent a letter to DT NNP in November 1997 ( Press Release 11/26/97 ) outlining its first product : a set of NN principles which were agreed upon to help DT task force in its policy deliberations . In DT letter , DT co-chairs of DT Council stated : " This consensus statement about NN policy from industry , environmental , citizen and NN and local leaders is , as far as PRP are aware , DT first such agreement on NN policy . " DT principles call for incentives for early action , international commitments , accountability , flexibility , strong measures to encourage technology , and fairness . Working group meetings began in February 1998 . • 1 . DT Working groups developed a set of recommendations to accelerate DT development and deployment of NN - friendly technology , principles for early action to reduce greenhouse gas NNS , and identified steps WDT MD be taken to foster broad - based community participation to realize DT benefits of NN protection . 2 . DT NNP Task Force transmitted DT Early Action Principles to DT NNP ( Transmittal Letter to DT NNP ) in October 1998 . text: MSNBC ’s Chris Hayes and Al Velshi moderate NN forum with presidential candidates and NBC NNP ’ Lester Holt visits Alaska during DT weeklong series Al Roker Is in Greenland on NASA Mission to NN Melting Glaciers for NNP in Crisis Series Al Roker has trekked to DT Arctic yet again — this NN for a NASA mission in Greenland to VB DT effects of NN NN on DT rapidly melting glaciers , and how NN levels are rising as a result . Months after traveling to Alaska to VB DT effects of NN NN on DT northernmost part of DT NNP NNPS , Today ’s longtime weather anchor flew in August with NASA NNS on their first - ever Oceans Melting Greenland / OMGNASA mission to VB just how fast DT NN ocean is melting DT region ’s massive NN sheets . Starting Sunday , NBC NNP , MSNBC , Telemundo and NBC NNP Digital will dedicate DT entire week ’s programming to DT NN crisis , showing how rapid changes in our environment are affecting PRP here in DT U.S. and in DT rest of DT NN . During DT series , NBC Nightly NNP anchor Lester Holt will report from Alaska , where he lived as a child while his father served in DT U.S. Air Force . He will show how NN temperatures are melting DT NN ’s famed Portage Glacier and thawing DT permafrost , which countless communities depend on to survive . “ PRP ’re seeing a shift in our very way of life because of NN NN , ” Roker , 65 , tells NNS . “ PRP ’re not trying to frighten NNS . PRP ’re trying to show NNS how this affects your everyday life and in ways big and small . ” “ PRP were out with folks who had been on a glacier WDT was retreating at DT rate of 10 to 15 feet a week , ” he says . As part of DT NNP in Crisis series , MSNBC ’s Chris Hayes and Ali Velshi will moderate NNP Forum 2020 , a two - day event where U.S. presidential candidates talk with young voters about their plans to lead DT country — and DT NN — into an uncertain future . Hosted by MSNBC , Georgetown Institute of Politics and NNP Service , Our Daily NNP and NNP York magazine , Hayes says he is interested to hear exactly how DT candidates will tackle DT NN crisis . He RB wants to ask DT candidates what PRP VBP DT NN will look IN in 2030 or 2050 . “ In other words , how seriously do PRP take this ? ” he says . “ EX are implications in healthcare , in immigration , in national security , in nutrition — everywhere about this . I VBP to VB a sense from these candidates about how PRP see PRP and more importantly , how do PRP convince NNS for whom NN NN might be a fact but PRP ’s not a priority ? ” Velshi says he saw DT effects of NN NN firsthand in DT Bahamas , where he reported from DT Abaco islands , which were “ reduced to rubble ” by Hurricane Dorian . “ I ’ve covered a lot of hurricanes and I ’ve seen a lot of devastation , ” he says . “ But this was IN a hurricane and a tornado and an earthquake . Since 2006 , NN levels have risen at a rate of 0.14 of an inch per NN — more than double DT rate over DT previous century . DT big question is what will happen next . No NN knows exactly where DT tipping point lies , but NNS have already seen troubling signs of rapid NN loss in places IN Antarctica ’s Thwaites Glacier , which alone contains enough NN to raise NN levels by 2 feet . “ DT is very worrying , ” VBD Regine Hock , a glaciologist at DT University of Alaska Fairbanks and an author of DT report . “ DT indications are RB IN instability might be on its way . ” ( Hock RB coordinated a chapter on high - mountain areas , which looked at DT impacts of shrinking glaciers and snowpacks on ecosystems and communities . ) Regardless of how much NN levels rise over DT long term , PRP will cause problems for coastal communities in DT short term because of increasingly devastating storm surges and high tides . In fact , CD NN found IN so - called 100 - NN floods will occur in Los Angeles about five times per NN by mid-century . DT ’s true no matter how quickly NNS reduce greenhouse gas NNS . NN waters have put JJ marine animals on DT move , and range shifts are expected to become more pronounced in DT future . CD analysis found IN some fish species along DT West Coast MD migrate as much as 600 miles north under a high - NNS scenario . ( Creatures WDT can’t relocate , IN corals , MD simply be eradicated . ) Some animals will thrive in their JJ homes and others will hit dead ends , forcing fishing industries to adapt . But on DT whole , unmitigated NN NN will decrease DT potential catch of JJ fisheries by 20 % , DT report concluded . A recent NN found IN meeting DT goals of DT Paris NN accord — which are to limit JJ NN to less than 2 degrees Celsius — MD protect 3 million tons of DT most lucrative fish catches . These gains MD benefit developing NNS DT most . DT report authors called on governments to protect ecosystems and NNS from these impacts . PRP emphasized DT need to slash greenhouse gas NNS , and to reduce other stresses on marine animals to give them breathing room to adapt to NN NN . EX is no NN - size - fits - all approach to making coastal communities more resilient , Cheong VBD , but governments MD help by improving early warning systems for disasters , encouraging residents to plan for NN NN when PRP rebuild , or , in some NNS , consider retreating altogether . DT report highlighted DT need to start adapting now for an uncertain future . “ PRP owe PRP to our NNS and future generations to plan for resilient communities while PRP can , ” VBD Jack Ainsworth , executive director of DT California Coastal Commission . “ History will judge PRP harshly if PRP do nothing or take halfhearted steps . ” In Oppenheimer ’s view , DT U.S. is particularly far behind . DT National Flood Insurance Program gives NNS an incentive to remain where PRP will be vulnerable to future storms , and DT NN ’s reactive approach means IN EX is often no money for adaptation until after a disaster has struck . “ These communities along DT coast are basically sitting ducks , ” he VBD . But EX are RB reasons to be hopeful . DT ocean holds DT potential to accomplish roughly a quarter of DT greenhouse gas reductions needed to meet DT Paris NN targets , according to a report released Monday by DT High Level Panel for a Sustainable Ocean Economy , a group of NNS and NN leaders convened by DT NNP Resources Institute . But fish is a green alternative . JJ fisheries are already overexploited . But researchers say IN smart management MD boost yields and be sustainable . “ PRP can VB more out of DT ocean if PRP just pay attention and manage PRP properly , ” Matthews VBD . Even so , EX ’s no escaping DT grim picture painted by DT IPCC report . If NN NN continues unabated , “ DT consequences for humanity are sweeping and severe , ” Barrett VBD . “ What ’s at stake is DT NN of ecosystems , wildlife and — importantly — DT NN PRP leave our NNS . ”
